review_text: Loved it, unfortunately a lot of people didn‚Äôt stay the 6ft apart, but everyone wore masks... lines were longer and took forever but for health and safety reasons I completely understand!!

title: Beware of fraudulent tickets
review_text: Bought tickets from a private party since the tickets are so expensive and we were trying to save some money. The guy sent tickets electronically before we sent payment. Went the next morning at park opening to validate tickets, waited in line for 1 hour at entrance but left before they could be validated as we had plans to visit Epcot that morning and didn‚Äôt want to arrive late. Since we were not able to verify the validity of the tickets because the line was too long, we transferred the funds to the person. Needless to say, we‚Äôre now down $500 and at least 1 hour filing a police report. After a little investigation of our own, we found out that this guy is notorious for selling fraudulent tickets and has us many charges and arrests for selling them. Don‚Äôt purchase tickets from this guy. By the way, he doesn‚Äôt go by Branden Bullerin as he uses his brothers name, who does not appear to be involved so I blacked out his name on the ticket.

title: Awful experience
review_text: The employees were rude and harassed us while we were secluded in our own space and followed us to every area. When you enter they say it‚Äôs okay to slip your mask down to take a break yet we get threatened and more. They have made it extremely uncomfortable and the complete opposite of fun. The way the lines were set up was a time waster and no one would have had time to explore and enjoy all the rides and exhibits. It‚Äôs a rip off of the cost and money it take s to enjoy the park with the low respect and time to do anything. It is completely different from the last time my family has gone and it gets worse and worse. Instead of focusing on the comfortability and and having fun, employees rushed and only focused on keeping ur mask over your nose and hand sanitizer. It is unacceptable for they way the tourists are treated and it was unenjoyable. The times the rides were open is ridiculous and should‚Äôve been open longer. Ever five minutes you had to put on hand sanitizers and if you were given too much normally you would wipe it off a bit but no the employees threatened, harassed, and followed you until you rubbed it all on. They focused more on being clean than enjoying your time here. I will never go again and I will tell everyone I know to not go.

title: Fun Day!
review_text: We love Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. I'm really glad we did not pay for the express passes. We visited on a Wed in mid Oct and did not wait long for any rides. We had to wear masks, but it wasn't too bad. You can tell they are short staffed in some areas, but there was great service in the busy places. 14 of us had the best day today!

title: Amazing!
review_text: We spent three days at Universal with a 16 and 12 year old. We had an absolutely amazing time there, even with COVID and having to wear masks in 90 degree heat! The employees were happy, amusing and tentative. Everything was spotlessly clean. There were designated employees just continually cleaning handrails and reminding visitors to wear their masks properly. Even the vehicles were socially distanced when parking (should do that all the time! haha!!) The rides were some of the best we have been on, and the little shows around the park were great! Especially loved the drumming builders...lol. So much to see and do for everyone. Visited Finnegan's for a proper sit down meal twice, was so yummy and husband was loving the real draught Guinness. Job well done to Universal for keeping spirits high during this unprecedented time!!! Keep it up!

title: Fun, but not fun
review_text: We were super excited to go to the Park until we got there.  They required mask, they checked temperature, but then one of our guest was harassed for wearing a bandana instead od a mask and there was a couple right before them with a bandana. First STRIKE!!  SECOND STRIKE! there were rides that were closed, mainly the good rides but the price of the tickets never changed.  THIRD STRIKE! As we were leaving one of the security guards, name Mike cussed my daughter bc as she was talking her mask was moving up and down showing a portion of her nose. He said in a disgusted tone-your mask should cover your nose! As we got closer she said, I was talking and my mask is moving. He said again with a tone in his voice, pull up the mask, so she stood in front of him and pulled up her mask and asked...like this? And walked away. As we were walking away he blurted out-Keep your masking on your F%&*ing face! Everyone stopped in their tracks.  We reported him to the supervisor who didn't show any concern for the matter. They will be getting a report filed.

title: Toon lagoon is my go to.
review_text: Can i just say everything was great all the team members were very helpful few in particular stood out above the rest, Mat jorge, and lauren at wimpys were the epitomy of what it means to work for a theme park and go above and beyond my son had a bday and was having a bad time because the cart we went to was out of churros and i knew my 5 year old wasn't understanding having to wait longer. The enthusiasm the happy bday wishes and free ice cream kept him happy i will not forget the best experience ive had in any theme park i have been to. Plus its the best burger in universal if you like a nice sizeable medium burger with a bit of pink in it like i do, guess what im saying is ill be returning and toon lagoon will remain my favorite

title: We Will Not Go Back Until Mask Restrictions Are Lifted
review_text: don't even know where to start. COVID has definitely left an ugly mark on the tourism industry. Universal Studios has so many enjoyable things to do. The employees work hard to keep things clean and give hand sanitizer to each person before going on a ride. There are marks on the floors where you wait for rides in order to encourage social distancing. Those are reasonable steps. But masks are required not only inside buildings, which might be a bit understandable, but outside in the Florida heat and humidity at all times. Maybe that would be necessary if we were packed like sardines and walking down every street thought the park. But that wasn't the case. We were outside, sticking together as a family group, avoiding being around other people, and STILL employees would ask us to pull our masks up or make sure they are over our noses. Outside. In the sun. By ourselves. It was ridiculous. They felt like mask Nazis. The announcements to wear masks were over the loud speaker. Employees were walking around with signs saying to wear a mask. It was hot and hard to breathe but unless you were actively eating or drinking, masks had to be on and up. Made for a truly miserable experience. Thankfully we won this trip to Universal Studios. We will NEVER come back until these ridiculous rules are ended!

title: Good Place to Eat and Watch
review_text: We stopped here and got some Dippin Dots and relaxed and watch the people walk by. Watch the boats on the canal and listen to the music.

title: Universal Studios Orlando
review_text: We had planned to come in March right as everything started shutting down. We canceled, attempted to go in June and canceled again. Finally we were able to come! They did a great job with social distancing. Not gonna lie, wearing a mask in 90 degree weather sucked but totally understand and better safe than sorry. I had read that the crowd level was predicted to be 4/10. Felt a lot busier, hour wait on rides and places to eat. I love that most of the lines were out of the sun and had air condition making it much cooler. Family favorites were the Butterbeer, Transformers, Harry Potter and The Mummy. The Mummy was so much more fast and scary than I was expecting! My husband and son did The Rip Ride Rockit too(it surprisingly had a short wait all day). We would definitely come back! Did not do all the rides but the ones we did were amazing.

title: Don't go until COVID restrictions lifted
review_text: We live in Central Florida and go to Universal once or twice a year. Today's visit was the worst we have ever had and I won't be going back any time soon.  The crowds were much bigger than I expected, especially for midweek, and the ride lines were extremely long. The popular rides were 90 to 120 minutes and the others were an hour plus or minus. I'm guessing that the lines were a result of the large crowds and the reduced ride capacity due to COVID restrictions.  More annoying than just the long lines was our experience on the Haggard ride. We had never been on it and it was the primary target of this trip. We arrived right at public opening time of 10am and the Haggard wait time was already 120 minutes. We got in line and moved along for an hour and fifteen minutes when they announce the ride was in a "temporary delay" due to technical issues. Expecting the delay to be short and not wanting to waste our wait, we waited for the next hour, along with thousands of others, until they finally announce the ride was closed for the day. I can't believe that they couldn't do a better job of managing the ride and wasting 2 hours and 15 minutes of our day at their park. Throughout the day I noticed on the Universal app that several other rides were closed at various time of the day.  One positive was that despite the large number of people, most people were social distancing and kept their masks on. I never really felt unsafe.

title: Enjoy the current resident special for $165 to the end of the year. Otherwise it's not worth it.
review_text: My boyfriend and I are both handicapped and require wheel chairs. We were so disappointed that most of the rides do not allow you to ride your wheel chair to the ride but instead you must use a hand operated wheel chair, which I wasn't able to do as I have no arm strength. Workers were not allowed to push us to the ride so we weren't able to enjoy the rides. There were quite a few rides, restaurants and shops that were closed. The park wasn't crowded at all and I noticed that most rides were around an hour or less wait. The busiest part of the park was the Harry Potter area and that was very enjoyable! Everyone was very good about wearing masks and there were plenty of area's to wash your hands or use sanitizer. Several of the rides have restricted seating size, so if you're over weight by much you can't fit into the seats. They have sample seats outside the rides but I was too embarrassed to try one out with others watching. I felt that charging $25 PLUS TAX to park was ridiculous considering the cost of a days' ticket! In conclusion, at the age of 64, handicapped and overweight, our theme park days are over with and better left to young, healthy and weight appropriate people. I'm glad I enjoyed them in my younger years.

title: Unsafe Experience at Univeral Florida City walk
review_text: We have spent several days at Disney Parks and decided to venture to Universal Studios CityWalk for dinner despite what we had read online about lack of safety procedures. Here is the truth: universal studios definitely attracts a lower class of people who have utter disregard for others. For every 5 people we saw there was either a person or group without a face covering or had their face covering under their nose or under their chin. They all were constantly in movement and not stationary while eating or drinking. No one follows physical distancing guidelines.  Security guards constantly passed pwople without masks on and ignored them. We saw many security guards gathered in groups completwlt ignoring what was going on around them.  We had a great experience outside on the patio at Margaritaville. Once actually seated (not while in line) they take a pandemic seriously.  Needless to say - the reviews we read were generous. If you take your health seriously at all and actually care about the possibility that you could be carrying something that could hurt others, do NOT go to Univeral Florida! After 1 short evening at CityWalk we will NOT be buying tickets to this theme park until long after the pandemic is over. Sad as this was one of our favorite places to visit.  If you want to get out safely, go to Disney. Step it up Universal - this is extremely unresponsible.

title: Very underwhelming!
review_text: I have planned some fantastic, fabulous vacations in my time. I like to do things myself because, frankly, I don't trust others. I HATE having to always find someone to ask. I feel like I'm wasting my time. This vacation was the lowest of the low for us. It was the most frustrating and disappointing vacation we have ever taken!  First, the good. The staff is phenomenal! Almost everyone we talked to was super helpful and friendly. The staff at the hotel (Lowes Royal Pacific) was the absolute best people to work with! We drove 15 hours to get there and arrived late Sunday night. We checked into our room at 10:30, unpacked, relaxed a few minutes, and went to bed. Thankfully I was the only one who noticed the toilet tank emptying and refilling every 30 minutes, but it kept me up all night long. I wrote to the hotel staff (they use text messaging as well as calls) and they had someone in to look at it within 20 minutes. The gentleman worked on it and left. This caused the toilet to do this every 5-8 minutes, so I wrote back. Same guy came back and said he had a few more pieces he could replace, but wasn't sure what was causing it. We went to the pool while he finished working. I got back in the room and found it was now doing this every 45 seconds! Writing again the gal asked if I'd like to change rooms. It was 9:30 PM and I said only if it was close by, as we had unpacked. She found us a room down the hall and we were moved in an hour. She, by no prompt from me, comped the parking fee (more on this later) ($125) for the inconvenience. Wonderful customer service!  I also want to point out specifically the staff in Volcano Bay. They are phenomenal and I highly recommend getting a cabana if you are going to be there all day. We had excellent service and their set-up is fantastic! Our lunch was brought to us and we had a personal attendant who made sure we always had towels and water. You also get a fruit/pastry basket, which was really nice.  The rides are all pretty fun. We rode almost every ride, the only 2 being the one we were not allowed to (Pteranadon Flyers), Popeye's Raging Rapids (a water ride and we didn't want to get wet), and the one that wasn't open when we got there (Woody Woodpecker). Most of their rides are very derivative of all the others. They are mostly 3D/4D with lots of spinning motion. Not a lot of variety on type of ride, but each ride has its own theme and more were pretty cool once. Hagrid's Motorbike ride was extremely enjoyable and innovative! It is one of the few rides anywhere worth the wait in line.  Now to the bad points. Do NOT under any circumstances purchase a vacation package unless you are prepared to not get what you paid for. We purchased this package in February. What we were told we were getting was an hour early park admission to Harry Potter Land and Volcano Bay. I looked at the website and everything indicated that it was an hour early into BOTH Harry Potter parks. We get there and I was told we are only getting an hour into Island of Adventure Harry Potter and Universal Studios Harry Potter is only an hour early on weekends. (What!?!) Plus, the hour early into Islands coincides with the opening time of Universal, so you actually lose an hour in that park if you want to try to get on Hagrid's Magical Motorbike (the only ride without fast pass capabilities) early as the line gets really long. Not only that, we went to Islands and Universal for 3 days and 2 of those days Hagrid's was delayed for an hour or more during early admission, so actually getting in early had no benefit what-so-ever.  The other thing that is on my ticket email that we purchased was an hour early in Volcano Bay. When we got there we were informed that we only got 30 minutes early. As far as I am concerned, this is illegal as we purchased something from them and they did not give it to us. I called their customer service to complain and he said, "we are unfortunately unable to open Volcano Bay just for you." I told him I wasn't calling for that. I want part of my money refunded as they sold me something they had no intention of providing! He was very condescending as he told me he understood how I felt, but he could do nothing. I was on the phone with him for 15-ish minutes to just have him be condescending and very unhelpful. I gave up and tried to enjoy my day.  When we purchased this package there was a clause about a possible parking fee, but nothing more than that. No number to check and no indication that people actually staying in the hotel will be charged a fee. I honestly thought if you didn't stay in a hotel you were charged, but if you did stay you were not. I get there to find out there is a $20+ a night charge and it will be another $125 for us to stay there. Why couldn't they just put that on the package online? It is extremely expensive to do this and after driving 15 hours, we aren't going to say never mind, we want a refund. I feel this is dishonest on Universal's part. They hide fees and know you'll pay them anyway when you get there. Yes, ours was taken off our bill, but that was because our room had a problem. It still seems unethical.  My last complaint was that we showed up for the early admission wanting breakfast at the Three Broomsticks, because their menu has a breakfast section. None of us ate due to this. We get there and it's not open. I ask a vendor on the "street" about it and she tells me breakfast is suspended at this time. There was no indication of that anywhere online or on their app (which everyone says to use)! I realize the app says to check times, but I would never have guessed they would up and decide not to serve breakfast at all. We had to wait until 10AM to get out of the Harry Potter part to find something to feed my children. I acknowledge that this is partly my fault, as I did not ask anyone and I should have, but like I said before, I hate not being able to plan vacations all by myself! There is no reason their app could not have been updated to indicate this or that an email couldn't have been sent to me saying all these changes they had made. The technology is out there.  The other technology flaw they have is for eating in restaurants in park. They want you to link a credit card to the app on your phone to order and pay that way. We do not link our credit cards or any banking information to our phones for privacy reasons and in case they were to get lost or stolen. Plus, we used gift cards to help control how much we spent. We went to eat at the Leaky Cauldron and sat for 10 minutes with no one coming to our table. I got up to go ask, as I knew I had to go to the register to order. I was told to go back to the table and do it on the app. I had to explain over and over again at every restaurant we ate that we were not doing that and I needed to go to the register. Most places were cool with it, but the Leaky Cauldron servers acted like I was crazy. It was frustrating to have to explain to everyone working what we needed as they pushed the pay by app on us everywhere we went.  We will never go back and my suggestion to anyone reading this is to not buy a vacation package or be prepared to be disappointed. Stay off site and buy tickets because you aren't going to get what Universal sells to you once you get there. Their customer service number is pointless, they use false advertising, and their technology is very unhelpful. I really wish I could say we got more out of this for what we paid. It was super frustrating and not very restful for the adults dealing with it all. Yes, I've been to Disney and they know how to take care of you so you have no worries and we got everything we paid for!

title: Islands of Adventure during pandemic
review_text: Even though Florida lifted restrictions. Universal did not. Mask at all times even outside in 90 degree weather They hassle you if it‚Äôs not over your nose. Lines r long from not filling rides. Most restaurants r closed so it takes hour for food. Good luck if you wanna eat inside in air conditioning. Website aside they closed at 9 but they closed at 7. I won‚Äôt be back as long as they‚Äôre trying to be politically correct!!!!

title: Without a Smart Phone We were EXCLUDED!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!
review_text: My husband & I visit Universal every year. This year we were excited as we've purchased tickets in advance and planned to both have the day off. but we don't have a smart phone. Without a smartphone there are issues eating in the restaurants and going on ride because we are unable to virtual cue anything. Tried to ask this question on your website but there is no link to e-mail. We always have a super time visiting Universal Studios. This year was a disappointment. Next time we will consider spending our money somewhere else. Thanks for nothing.

title: Harry Potter Stuff was great!
review_text: Get to Hogsmead and Three Broomstick early and I highly recommend the Fast pass will save a long of time in line

title: Don‚Äôt bother going without a fast pass
review_text: Without the fast pass don‚Äôt plan on riding any of the premier rides. We went yesterday and were only able to ride one ride. Plan on around $400 per person if you are not staying at a universal hotel. Go ahead and get the fast pass if you want to ride. If you just want to go play and enjoy the park you don‚Äôt need one.  Instead of requiring fast passes to do anything, why don‚Äôt you just start charging people $400 each and limit the number of people you allow in so everyone can enjoy? That way people can budget and be prepared?  I will remember this next time for sure and get fast passes ahead of time.

title: We would certainly return for a day full of adventure
review_text: It was a great experience with 5 teenagers on a birthday trip. The lines weren't too long and food lines were moving as well. Lots of areas to tests and take masks off and lot of sanitizing

title: Misleading overpriced ticket
review_text: Comparing to LA Universal - this one is close to nothing. 1. Ticket is either one of the parks, if you pick one the other is not letting you in. 2. Minions virtual line never has any spots 3. Lines for food 4. Realistic picture: It is just narrows down to three shows during the day and is was $700 for four people. $700 for three tiny 12-min shows and multiple hours in lines.  Totally regret

title: Not helpful, families with disabilities be aware
review_text: Below is an email that i wrote to the guest services of universal and am sharing with you:  I must tell you about an experience at your park today that has been completely mishandled and is the single reason our family will not be purchasing the remaining 4 annual passes we planned to and may never visit again. My mother and son visited yestersay with their annual passes and endured the day of standing in line regularly, as my mother is a proud person. However, I had made sure she had all the paperwork for her disability. Including her handicap plaque and doctors information regarding her degenerative joint disease. Extended periods of walking and standing causes joint swelling to the point of not being able to walk. This morning, I advised her to put her pride aside and go speak to guest services regarding an assistance pass. She did and was advised to get a wheelchair instead. She was embarrassed and crying so when they offered her a manual wheelchair, she took it and was unable to even use it, so instead a women with an aleady debilitating disease was pushing around her own wheelchair. This is unacceptable. I called guest services after they had been in line for over an hour for one ride because my mom was crying in pain and i wanted to know how to advise her to get the assistance she needed. The guest service person told me since she had been standinh in line for over an hour, it was obvious she could stand in line qnd they accommodated her as much as they could. He then asked me to explain why it was medically an issue, which goes against the hiipa laws and i explained it. He said she would need to go to guest services and explain it and if they could do anything, they would decide. I asked to speak with a supervisor bc after almost 5 hours in the park, they want to leave and i wanted to assist them any way I could by perhaps granting them a few express passes so their last day was somewhat salvageable. Since they are annual pass holders, my mom was saying she did not believe they would ever return and I also wanted to discuss if we could reverse their pass to a 2 day pass and be done with universal. We gave up our Disney passes for all 6 of our family members bc we felt we were at the age with the kids to enjoy universal , but are now very sure we made a huge mistake and I needed to discuss this with them. Her plan is to leave the park asap and never come back, but I have asked her to stop at guest services to try and speak with a manager . She stated she is humiliated enough already and I am 3 hours away and can not do anything. I felt it was important that someone understand exactly what happened, and I will be posting this everywhere I can bc anyone whose family suffers needs to know this story and be aware . I was also told via guest services that there is no sort of disability pass bc ppl have different disabilities and each person would have to explain theirs (which my mother did and provided proof

title: Wait until Covid is over- don‚Äôt waste your time
review_text: I‚Äôve been an annual pass holder before- I was so disappointed this trip. Some rides are by virtual reservation only. Good luck getting one of those. They are only available on the app which just clocks until it says ‚Äúcheck back at another time‚Äù. Not sure what the cost of my ticket paid for. The rules are insane. I was sitting in a restaurant and our table was next to the bar, yet my husband had to go outside in the sun and wait in a line outside the restaurant to just come back inside to get us a beer. They wouldn‚Äôt give him mine either even though I sent my ID with him and there was a sign saying 1 drink per ID. Now as we sit eating the fries we were forced to order or leave, patrons are 3 deep in front of the same bar. It‚Äôs like employees have carte blanche here. Also, I was harassed about my mask not being on in 100 degrees while I was trying to drink one of my $5 waters. It used to be so fun to come here. What a revelation.

title: Great experience
review_text: Everything was wonderfull. Great service, bathrooms clean, 5 star atractions. Great food and restaurants.

title: DO NOT GO! They oversell tickets and close the park because of covid limitations
review_text: They turn you in circles from trying to park to walking to the entrance to waste time to finally tell you they are at capacity. We got rerouted for parking then walked about 15 mins to get to the gate after temp checks and security.  They oversold tickets for the day to let you know that they are at capacity after you finally reach the gate despite the ticket you purchased. We arrived at 11am because we figured we would stay until closing.  Really disappointed with UNIVERSAL ORLANDO. Way to disappoint excited children.  Instead of waiting hours for a maybe ticket that we realized we purchased we fought for a refund that was not nearly what we spent for our original tickets after jumping through so many hoops and talking to multiple associates that told us something different. Regardless we are so glad we didn‚Äôt stand there for hours in 90 degree weather for a maybe ticket. We left and made the best of the rest of our day.

title: Worse rip off then ever!
review_text: Don't bother unless you buy the express pass. Not only do you get to ride in 1/4 of the time of peasants with normal tickets, express lines can be packed toe-to-toe. You can buy your way out of the pandemic spacing imposed on peons.

title: The best park
review_text: Cast team was fabulous, everything was great. I can't wait to go again. The best park at orlando. Yujuuu

title: Don‚Äôt go to universal studios!! Rip off!!!!
review_text: The magic was gone with all of their restrictions. Certain attractions were closed almost no characters walking around and interacting with the kids. Better to wait until worth full price. It‚Äôs a scam I felt cheated out of my money.full park price is not worth it.Face painting is still full 15$ price for half the face when it should be whole face. Also the new policy of keeping masks on during your ENTIRE stay in the hot Florida heat was very very difficult. They do have rest areas where you can take your mask off, but that didn‚Äôt make the experience better. The entire time we were there we were being harassed by employees about the masks. You can be 10 ft away from someone or no one around at all, and there will be someone to harass you about pulling your mask up. It took away from what could have been a waaaay better experience. My husband was playing and talking but with our daughter and they told him to not lower his mask. He flipped out because he was enjoying the moment counting owls in the Harry Potter side of park with our 2 year old and the moment was ruined. Felt like we were in jail or school. Definitely won‚Äôt be coming back until restrictions are lifted.

title: Great Place to go with family and friends!
review_text: Universal is a fun place for people of all ages. They have plenty of things to do like ride rides, attend shows, and eat. They have so many good restaurants in the parks and in City Walk. One of my favourites is the Chocolate Emporium where they have amazing specialty milkshakes. It gets very crowded in the summer and around holidays so i would suggest staying in a Universal Resort that offers fast passes. I have stayed in the Portofino, Royal Pacific, and Hardrock all of which have beautiful scenery and a wonderful staff. The resorts offer a ferry boat ride to the parks or you can use the short walking trails. If you don't want to stay at a Universal Resort another option to cut down wait times is to use the single rider line. It's great if you don't mind being separated from your party. It was overall a wonderful experience and I will definitely be back!

title: Decent Covid precautions but amazing deals
review_text: The park did a decent job of reopening for Covid. There is social distancing, temperature checks, hand sanitizing stations, and masks are required. At some points, there were large crowds, especially when the park closed, so I recommend leaving 30 minutes before the park actually closes. The virtual lines worked very well and I never felt uncomfortable in a line with too many people. The new deals Universal is offering are amazing and I plan on going back a few more times this year. The new Harry Potter ride is amazing!

title: MY EXPERIENCE
review_text: There were many rides to go on and with the fast pass I was able to do many rides over the curse of the day. I loved going to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter as I felt it was a good representation of the movies/books and was very cool to see. The lines however can be long sometimes and the food is expensive. I feel as though it's worth it for the memories you make and the overall experiences you gain from this park. I think it is very worth it, to visit and travel here and you will not regret your decision.

title: Very entertaining and a very fun place that you can enjoy!
review_text: Universal Studios is a very fun and entertaining place to visit! It is full of rollercoasters and plenty of rides. Not to mention that it includes great, delicious food around the whole park. This is a very exciting place to go filled with lots of adventures. I would definitely recommend others to go and have a blast creating countless memories!

title: great for covid precautions but horrible virtual lines
review_text: the park is taking great measures with covid but the virtual lines are a disaster had to complain to guest services in order to be able to ride several rides otherwise becuase of their system we would of missed most of it

title: Visit in COVID times
review_text: This was our first theme park visit since the pandemic started so we were not sure what to expect. When parking, every other parking space was blocked off to allow social distancing. Masks were required, except when eating. The few traditional waiting lines had distance markings on the floor. Parades and street shows were not present. Some photo with characters were allowed but only with the visitor a few feet in front of the characters. The biggest change however was with most wait lines that were converted to virtual: You use your app to reserve a future time, saving you from waiting in long lines. This sounded great except that it didn‚Äôt work at all for us! We arrived a little after noon and by that time there were zero time slots available! We were wondering why would they let people in the park if they cannot get on any of the rides? Talking to Universal team members, we were told to check the app as they would release time slots every hour. That did NOT happen. Actually it did a few hours later but the app froze and didn‚Äôt allow us to reserve the slots it briefly displayed. This repeated a few times and we suspected the system just wasn‚Äôt working. That could have totally ruined our experience, but we were saved by the friendly Universal team members. When we explained the issue and showed them screen shots of time slots we attempted but failed to secure, they actually allowed us to use these time slots as if we were able to capture them! This allowed us to go on the Mummy, Jimmy Fallon, and Harry Potter. We also stood in the traditional lines for the Simpsons and Men In Black. So these 5 rides plus walking around the park, shopping at the Hello Kitty store, and getting Butter Bear ice cream made the trip worthwhile. One other issue: I wear eye glasses and it was raining lightly the entire day Saturday. Most of the rides require 3-D glasses. These didn‚Äôt work well for me as they kept slipping off (maybe due to sanitizer used before handing them to you). Even worse, with the mask on, my eye glasses got fogged up very quickly and so it was hard to see the 3-D show! Still I did enjoy it and the rest of my family that don‚Äôt wear glasses didn‚Äôt have this issue. Big thanks to the awesome Universal staff for doing everything they can to create a safe and pleasant experience for their guests despite the difficult circumstances.

title: A memorable tour with usual as expected fun and joy with family
review_text: We actually went in Aug-2019 during summer break to Universal Studios Florida. It was well planned tour by my 13 year old son and he made all reservations, day wise plan for each places to tour at Florida. We really enjoyed the time with fun and joy. Couple of rides were really different than what we enjoyed in past. All together our experience with the accommodation that we booked in their resort was not at all good. We recommend to avail better options available in Hotels there. It will be good, comfortable selection by all means including cost.

title: it was magical
review_text: Special effects we loved this visit, our children had already discovered it through the comments read on the internet, they each made a list with their visit preferences, it was magical

title: The staff makes this place awesome!
review_text: The staff working here makes this theme park amazing!! Best theme park employees ever. So nice and helpful. My husband and I (just got married two weeks ago)! went to Universal Studios Florida & Islands is Adventure for the first time ever today (Sept 30). We had the absolute best time. Covid precautions were handled wonderfully with everyone wearing their masks, temperature checks before check in and sanitizer before every ride. Tons of spacing and social distancing on every attraction. We felt totally safe and comfortable and we have been very cautious about Covid for this entire pandemic. I am a huge Harry Potter Superfan and we have spent some time out in the California HP world and universal studios park. Always love it and have a great time but Florida tops it by a mile due to having not just Hogsmeade but also the Diagon Alley world! We went to Ollivanders wand shop in Diagon Alley because I have always wanted to partake in the ‚Äúwand chooses the wizard‚Äù experience/show. In LA pre-Covid, lines were hours long for this attraction and fast passes were not used towards it, so I have never done this experience but always wanted to. We spoke with a lovely girl working in Ollivanders Diagon Alley named Jessica who showed us how to get to the back of the shop where the wand experience sign ups were. I‚Äôm not sure if Orlando always does this Or if it is due to Covid, but they were signing people up to reserve times for later in the day. We were thrilled that times were still available and we didn‚Äôt have to wait in a 5 hour line to have the experience! Taylor was doing the wand experience sign ups - she was super nice and even fit us in at a wand appointment that was a perfect time for us (12 noon)! She was so helpful and great.  We were really excited about our wand appointment, and since we had a reservation time, we could actually walk around the park for a bit and then come back to our wand appointment. I was absolutely shocked when they brought just myself and my husband inside!! Because of Covid they were only doing one family/group at a time. I couldn‚Äôt believe it. I had to try not to cry in public, I was so thrilled, lol. They brought us inside by ourselves and I was able to do the wand experience - something I‚Äôve always dreamed of doing. I felt just like Harry in the book/movie. It was a really wonderful once in a lifetime opportunity that I am so grateful to Taylor, Jessica and the whole team for. At the end, I of course bought my wand, and Jessica happened to be the sales clerk! She mentioned the wand holder and the masks for sale and I bought them also. Their team made the day one I will never forget for sure.  We also grabbed a fire whiskey/cider combination from Janessa who made an excellent drink and was very friendly as well, and a butterbeer ice cream from Fortescue‚Äôs which was great.  Then we took the Hogwarts Express over to the Islands park. Wow! Looks just like the movie. Because of Covid, each family/group once again, gets their own compartment on the train!!! Such a a cool experience. Again, because of Covid it you got your own space heading over to the next park, which was pretty awesome, and the experience was wonderful.  My husband and I also went on the Hagrids Motorbike ride at the very end of the day. Though we bought the fast pass, that didn‚Äôt work towards Hagrid‚Äôs (we were told it is because it is too new of a ride). We got in line one minute of 6pm (park closure) and the line said it would be a 90 min wait - but we only waited 30 min! We both agreed it was the best ride we have ever been on (and he‚Äôs been on a ton of roller coasters). Completely worth the wait. Super exciting and with Hagrid and the other creature animatronics there it was a very creative and fun ride. Even my husband, who isn‚Äôt nearly as big a Potter fan as me, loved it and thought it was very thrilling.  I would highly recommend anyone who is interested in checking out a theme park right now to go to Universal & Islands, and any Harry Potter fans should absolutely go now! In fact, we had so much fun that we are hopefully taking my parents to the park and going again this week!

title: Rip Off
review_text: We paid over 2 thousand dollars for our tickets (FULL PRICE) and everything but the rides and the outside hot dog stands were closed. They should be offering discounts not charging full price. The rides were great, especially Harry Potter world. They did a good job of making sure everyone had their masks on properly and stood six feet apart but that full price thing has turned me off of Disney forever.

title: dream vacation
review_text: i was so existing to had the experience of all universal movies games such as transformers , minions , fast & furious i had the rollers coaster journey takes a great photos there are a variety of restaurants hope to take my kids there oneday

title: Disappointing
review_text: It has become a premium park with their additional Express Pass that they want you to buy. They now have several rides that are only available through their virtual que system. If you buy the additional Express Pass you will have no problems reserving a spot on the virtual que. with just a general admission ticket, we couldn‚Äôt get a virtual pass. They release them at specific times, you click on the App to reserve a virtual pass, it spins for 1-2 minutes and tells you they are all out of passes on the virtual que. At that point it‚Äôs too late to try for a different virtual que, all of them go in seconds upon release. We tried 3 times the same day at the designated times and got zero virtual passes. About 1/3rd of the rides are off limits with general admission alone. No standby line for those virtual que rides. It was the worst visit I have ever had. It wasn‚Äôt worth visiting. 1 Star is too generous.

title: Relax, go with the flow, have a wonderful time.
review_text: I knew there would be COVID precautions and I was a little worried after reading the negative reviews and customer complaints. Social distancing is handled very effectively by the park. I was amazed that they were able to accomplish keeping people 6 feet apart even in the serpentine lines. The drawback to the social distancing lines equated to longer lines. However, the ride experience itself was better. for instance on MIB. The wait would have been 5 minutes. But now due to social distancing its 15. But after a 15 minute wait my wife and I were place in our own car. This in my opinion makes the wait worthwhile. I even bought the ride photo. And it was pretty much the same throughout the park. To sum it up. Go to the park be patient and relaxed and have loads if fun.

title: Universal Orlando large Crowds
review_text: The parks seem more crowded than Disney World parks. Though guest were required to ware masks, many were not worn properly.

title: Amazing
review_text: Without a doubt, it is the activity that we preferred for the special effects, it feels like reality, it was magic

title: COVID Review
review_text: Harry Potter area was spectacular. Truly spectacular.  Some of the other rides were great.  Some of the rides haven't seen a coat of paint in 15 years.  We are, admittedly, Disney fans and are used to the constant improvement of Disney parks and technology. Universal really went all out on Harry Potter portions, but some of the older rides and areas needs TLC.  The app has clunky parts. The photo package is totally bizarre compared to Disney. Pictures are manually added, you have to get a print out slip at Will Call to then turn around and activate it in the park to get a necklace, and then every picture is manually added. And the pictures don't even show up in the Universal app! We still have some that were taken and not added.  We did the Express Pass--which was super helpful on a few rides, kind of helpful on most rides, and useless on some rides (because their was no line--MIB and ET, for example). It also excludes Hagrid's Motorbike (which we didn't know until we tried to get in line).  Kids loved, loved the interactive wands--especially in Diagon Alley.  Also weird--all adults needed ID with their tickets to get into the park. This wasn't disclosed anywhere in advance (or was done so small we didn't see it). Fortunately, we all had it, but it could have been a problem.  Do we wish they would improve some of the customer service pressure points? Yes!  Would we still go again (and spend most of our time in the Harry Potter portions? Yes!  They were less stringent about COVID restrictions, which was fine with us. Lots of spacing in rides and restaurants--virtually no enforced restrictions in any of the stores. Hand sanitized before every ride.

title: fun, social distancing, Harry Potter area excellent
review_text: temp checks, and social distancing practiced.Harry potter area amazing, try the butter beer frozen. The attraction wait times were all about 15-20 minutes max Great time had by all

title: Doing a great job during COVID!!
review_text: This is the first time I have gone to universal since COVID happened and I am pretty shocked how well they are handling things at the park. From cleaning the rides everytime someone gets off, to giving you hand sanitizer before you get on and once you get off, and even making sure while waiting in line everyone is 6+ feet from each other enforcing social distancing. The park was pretty empty when my boyfriend and I went and lines we‚Äôre no more than 10-15 minutes. (:

title: Awesome rides and shows, helpful, friendly people
review_text: Fantastic fun for all ages, and very impressed with their COVID precautions. There's not single ride my family didn't enjoy, and food stands were generous with free ice water in the hot sun. Harry Potter area workers especially helpful with amusing children. Afterward, got in touch to buy souvenirs from stores that were closed when we left and person on phone was very helpful. Expensive, but you get what you paid for. Don't miss the Monster Makeup show!

title: Amazing especially during Covid
review_text: I visited Universal last weekend and it was amazing. Limited capacity and extra cleaning made it a great trip. I felt extremely comfortable with the way they handled each guest and each ride. Hand sanitizer was mandatory before getting on any ride and was available after each ride. They also limited the rides to each group so you aren‚Äôt sitting with strangers. Definitely worth the money to go while it‚Äôs slow.

title: Harry Potter Experience Worth It!
review_text: We went to Universal during the peak of the COVID surge, a few weeks after it re-opened in June. We had a wonderful time. Mask wearing was enforced and there was hand sanitizer everywhere. Especially enjoyed the Harry Potter rides and Hagrid's Magical Creatures Motorbike Adventure is incredible and worth waiting for. Lines were short and we were able to rush through both Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure in a day (rushed through, mostly Harry Potter). Hogwarts Express is a must-ride and there were plenty of other fun rides. Parts of Universal feel dated and need to be revamped (Superhero rides, Dr. Seuss section). Some staff members are wonderful, others are just ok as to helpfulness and willingness to answer questions. There was more mask difficulty at CityWalk where staff members were telling people to wear masks properly but were being ignored by guests. Overall, we loved our trip though we can't imagine what it would be like when it was busy and we would have to wait in long lines.

title: Great time, great experience
review_text: Wizarding World of Harry Potter is amazing. The detail, shops, staff. Do everything you can rides, shops, interactive wands. Simpsons, Minions, MIB.. Transformers is the best 4D experience, and is a must do. I suggest if you have kids 10 and under rent a stroller.

title: Amazing family holiday
review_text: We came on a holiday before here and it was amazing and this time over it was pretty much the same with some new rides, all of the facilities were great and all the staff were helpful if we got lost overall it was a great holiday away

title: Safety is priority.
review_text: They really take safety seriously, every single attraction is packed with hand sanitizer and someone that makes sure every person gets it. Keeping social distance is priority on the rides and the park in general is super clean, including restrooms. The staff is very kind and professional since you step into the park. Thank you for such a nice attitude that keeps people coming back.

title: Great Customer Service
review_text: Spent a great weekend at Universal. Initially had a problem getting into the park because of a ticket issue that we caused, but Donnie at the front gate helped us correct our mistake. The staff is on top of the mask wearing by reminding people politely and they are good at keeping the recommended spacing in lines. Then to top it all off, we lost our car keys and Universal arranged for a cab to get us back to the hotel. I figured it would be another $75+ or so but to our surprise, Universal picked up the tab for the cab. Thank you Maria at Guest Services. I cannot say enough about the staff at the park. I've been in the past but it really feels like they're going way above and beyond. I will definitely be back.

title: Best Day This Year So Far..
review_text: Best day this year so far! We went yesterday, 9/6/2020. I took my 14 year old son, 6 year old daughter, and 3 year old son. This was their first time. We all had an equally great time. My little guy even got to ride 10 rides which I didn‚Äôt think was possible at Universal Studios, and loved every one especially Harry Potter. All my kids in unison said it‚Äôs way better than Disney! Posted wait times were overstated. We never waited for any ride for more than 25 minutes and it goes by so fast. One of my concerns was that we would not be able to ride the Harry Potter ride which was part of the Virtual Line rides, and we didn‚Äôt have express passes. I kept checking throughout the day for times to return to no avail. I already gave up on riding it, and was really disappointed, and we were getting ready to leave when they opened up the stand by queue!!! I was SO HAPPY even though the wait was close to 2 hours long. I didn‚Äôt care. I was sure it was worth it. However we didn‚Äôt have to wait even 5 minutes because we were one of the lucky few that got pulled out of the line by a Harry Potter angel named MIRANDA and taken right up to the ride by a ‚Äúsecret passage‚Äù with an elevator, and when we got to the boarding area we were the first and only ones there and at my daughters request got to ride in the first row! I cannot in words describe the gratitude I felt and actually cried after we got off the ride because I was so touched by Miranda‚Äôs actions and her interactions with my kids. She said she‚Äôs taking us a secret way because my 3 year old had the cutest mask on and kept it on the whole time with no complaints. I will forever be grateful for this experience that not only made my whole day, but our whole trip! Because of this we still had time to ride the minions ride and shop at gift shops. The only reason for 4 stars is because our dining experience was less than perfect. We got to the Krusty Burger at 2pm and did not get our food until 3:43pm. And that was after sitting down at our assigned table with a number for over 20 minutes, at which point I had to ask an associate more than once to please check on our order which was placed over and hour ago. With 2 young kids that act like they haven‚Äôt eaten in months, while watching everyone around them eat, it was not a pleasant and relaxing lunch that I anticipated. Other than, 5 stars all the way!! I am now seriously considering season passes as we live in Palm Beach County and I can totally see coming here at least once a month, and definitely for special events.

title: Universal sucks
review_text: Our day was practically ruined!!! So we go into universal studios and it was all fine but then we find out that there is a thing called virtual line which Is for like all of the good rides, and we were ok ok we just have to make a reservation that‚Äôs all. NO let me explain how it works. Basically you have to make a time reservation for the ride you want to go on but when we tried making the reservation but there were non available and when there finally was I clicked it super fast and it said oh sorry another person already booked it and it says that every tine so we couldn‚Äôt go on any rides in universal studios but I do recommend islands of adventure there is no virtual line for anything and is waaaay funner for kidsüòÑ

title: Larger Crowds Than Anticipated Due to COVID
review_text: We just returned from a stay at Royal Pacific with a 4 day park to park ticket option. We enjoyed our stay at Royal Pacific but this review will specifically be for the parks only.  Our stay was from 09/03-09/07. We went in knowing that our stay would include a weekend and a holiday weekend at that. We anticipated larger crowds but we were expecting some better precautions in place in regards to managing crowds.  Once the parks hit capacity for the day it was apparent that there were just too many people in the parks. I understand that the parks are following state guidelines but capacity limits need to be reevaluated. It was especially difficult to distance ourselves from other groups in Diagon Alley, Hogsmeade and as a whole, Islands of Adventure. It was apparent that staff were extremely overwhelmed by the crowds and were having a difficult time managing everybody. There was also just no way to maintain 6 feet away from the party ahead of you or behind you in certain areas of the park and in certain queues once they extended past where the floor markings were. It would have been helpful if there were team members stationed throughout the queues monitoring guests and separating as needed.  Again, we truly did anticipate and prepared ourselves for dealing with higher than average crowds due to the weekend and Labor Day, but we were surprised by the capacity allowed in the parks right now, especially if it can't be managed appropriately.  With that said, we still had a wonderful time but would definitely advise those who are traveling to Universal right now to avoid the weekend if at all possible.

title: Great family vacation
review_text: our 1st family vacation in 6 yrs. Had a great time, just a few problems that came up. Parks opened up at different times. Our early entry pass was basically no ggod because the rides didnt open up until 2 hrs after the park. The transformers oicture was not delivered to our hotel as promised, and we still havent gotten it. Said they would mail it. Watch your charges on the hotel bill. We stayed at Lowes Royal Pacific. Although it is a wonderful hotel and the staff was great, they overcharged, and duplicate charged us. Our bill totaled 531.61, even gave us a credit back, on paper. When I chececked my account it was double chared and for more than the bill, by 131.40. I cant get zhold of anyone in accounting because of the holiday so my money, 760.00 is sitting there and I cant use it. Took me a year to save up for this vacation, aand they want to do this to me.

title: Two Hours To Park / Two Ticket Reprints / Not Worth The Price
review_text: Booked our trip to Universal in late July for Memorial Day Weekend. We knew there where limited spaces etc so we wanted to be sure to reserve our space. If the park was operating at partial capacity I hate to see what it looks like at full capacity. We waited 2 hours to go 1.5 miles into the parking lot. Once inside it‚Äôs very confusing of which way to go to get to what resort. Finally found our way over to Universal Island of Adventure. Went to Kiosk and entered code for Will Call tickets, printed and proceeded to gate. Scan tickets ‚ÄúVoided tickets must go to Guest Services‚Äù. 35 minute wait at guest services, reprinted tickets and off to the island we went. Ride one ride with Xpress pass and head to next...‚ÄùSorry, this Xpress pass is for Universal Studios, you must got back to guest services‚Äù. 45 minute wait at guest services ticket reprinted and off to ride another ride... ‚ÄúSorry, weather in the area no rides can operate‚Äù. Wait another 45 minutes to pass ride a few rides and then go to next ride and it doesn‚Äôt except Xpress Pass and no Virtual Line availability. Constant strike after strike. Our day for 2 was $528.00 for 2 tickets and 2 Xpress Passes. We rode 5 rides and called it a day as the place was packed, their is construction everywhere, the place is filthy, the staff walks around in regular clothes just to harass people in between drinks of water or bites of food to put their mask back on. The rides are mediocre at best. Nothing gives you a big ‚Äúwow‚Äù factor. I have been to Universal Studios side before and it was much better and seemed cleaner and more friendly. City walk is great but they are renovating a giant area of it so it‚Äôs not what it normally is. Overall it wasn‚Äôt that enjoyable but the show will go on and many people will enjoy it.

title: Rides are good but not much improvements since our last visit
review_text: Note: The trip was actually in August 2019 but was not able to select it in the drop down list. This is our family's third trip to Universal Studios Florida. I would select Good as a rating vs Very Good but the option is not available.  Areas of improvement ‚Ä¢ High cost of parks ‚Ä¢ Rides not being in operation. In the five days that we were at the parks, multiple rides were not in operation. The most frustrating ride that was down that had the most impact was the Hagrid‚Äôs Magical Creatures Motorbike Adventure. ‚Ä¢ Rides are closed at the first sign of inclement weather, even when there is nothing seen or if the storm is 15 miles away. This includes pools at the resorts as well and water taxis. ‚Ä¢ Standing in line many hours for the popular rides means paying for the day and going on only a few rides.  Keep doing ‚Ä¢ Parks and resort clean ‚Ä¢ Staff mostly friendly and courteous

title: Clean and safe visit at Universal
review_text: We visited Universal Studios in late July to celebrate our daughter's HS grad. We want to commend Universal for how safe they made us feel at the parks, hotels and on citywalk. Everyone kept their masks on, socially distanced and kept things clean. The only part I would have them improve on is the hand sanitizer they use in the parks smells very bad. Disney's hand sanitizer is like purell and adds something to it to make it smell pure or good. I think they must be using a cheap version and I would say for them to review what type they are forcing people to use as it stinks and feels terrible on your hands. We didn't stay at a hotel this time to get the free Universal Express as there were no huge lines. We rode rides multiple times and had a great day. There are places to rest if you want to take off your mask and eat/drink and I would advise to do a sit-down lunch. We ate at the Leaky Cauldron and the only part that was strange is you are seated and order at your table as they don't want lines outside otherwise everything was really good. The only other suggestion for Universal in general is stop making people use lockers on rides like Men in Black. I do like the new locker system since our last visit to get your items in/out as it was much quicker than the thumb scan but make sure you keep your park ticket with you to reopen your locker. Weekdays are less crowded than weekends if you are from out of town like us.

title: Pay huge to bury yourself under hot sun
review_text: Painful, irritative and troublesome service from the park. Each ride is more than 60 min wait time(wait 60 min under hot sun and have a ride for 5 min) . You have to buy the full fare of the maximum priced ticket offered or else they will make sure u will leave park disappointed. We bought 4 day promotional offer at 320$ per person. And we were not able to complete atleast one park for two days. Terrible experience. Six flags would be far better cheaper and far better thrilling.

title: really fun you should do it
review_text: I sang there with my chorus it was really fun because afterword we got to do the whole park we had so much fun with my family.

title: Best Day Ever!!
review_text: Where to start, this exceeded my expectations in every way. We decided to book a two park pass and do them both in one day, we also upgraded to fast pass which was the best thing we did as it wouldn‚Äôt have been possible to get on all the rides if not. We started off in islands of adventure and worked our way through the park and then over to universal studios. Each area was done spectacularly but the stand out area for me was the world of Harry Potter, the simulation ride in the castle was my fav ride of the whole park. I can‚Äôt wait to visit again!!!

title: Vacation
review_text: My family had a great time at universal theme park. They make sure they clean and sanitized the rides. We will come back.

title: Amazing! Enjoyed every minute
review_text: I never was able to go to universal before, one day I randomly got the Florida resident promotional pass, so I‚Äôve been there a few times now since they have opened back up a few months ago. I see other people complaining about wearing face masks in the heat all day and blah blah blah, but considering myself and every single staff member at universal ALSO has to wear their face masks for our entire shifts (I work at Chickfila, taking orders outside) NOBODY SHOULD BE COMPLAINING! I admit when I had to first wear a mask all day at my job it was uncomfortable to get used to, but now it‚Äôs like I‚Äôm not even wearing one. GET OVER YOURSELVES. I would say ‚Äúfirst world problems‚Äù but considering the whole world is going through this pandemic together, it just shows how spoiled Americans really are.  I must commend the amazing things universal parks are doing following CDC guidelines. I for one absolutely LOVE the social distancing stickers because I don‚Äôt have people breathing down my neck, and can be comfortable while waiting in line.  Speaking of lines, if you go on a weekday, they are nowhere near as busy as weekends. So feel free to come during the week if you want to complain about wait times, or fork it over for the fast pass. You cannot blame the park for wait times, if the park is busy.  I honestly have been about 5 times and will most likely go again tmrw, because I am absolutely loving every single experience I have had so far. All the staff have been so friendly and inviting, and I am actually really glad that ALL the staff is being so serious about everyone wearing face masks.  Thank you universal, I really appreciate your effort and each time I‚Äôve gone it‚Äôs been so much fun.

title: Great birthday activitu
review_text: I took my husband for his birthday with a Florida resident promotion we had too.for Tuesday Sept 1. The parks were empty until after lunch. We only waited for the train in both directions and then it was 15 minutes in ac. I absolutely loved hagrid ride. So fun. My husband did not feel great due to the mask being so hot. But We still had a ball.  All the staff was super friendly. Yes they asked people to pull their masks up. That is their job and duty. If you cannot abide by this then wait until masks are not being mandatory. No one likes wearing them.  We did not like the butter beer and $8.50 is crazy. Parking is also expensive st $26. I know they all charge. Be prepared to walk a lot but there are so many cafes and air cond places.  We can't wait to come back.

title: Not as We Remembered it Five Years Ago!
review_text: We visited Universal on August 25 (Tuesday). We arrived around 10:00 AM. We experienced everything except the ET ride and Bourne. We stayed until 5:00. We did not have express passes. It was quite empty. If we waited, it was because we had to wait until the next show, etc. Which was never more than 20 minutes. We had been here five years ago. Nothing seemed new. We enjoyed Diagon Alley because no one was around. So easy to navigate. What we did notice is that the qualify of the virtual rides have diminished. We loved the Simpsons five years ago. Rode it many times. This time, just once. At first I just thought it was my eyes getting older :) but my teenage daughter complained that the screens were not that clear. Even the Harry Potter was blurry. We were really disappointed by this park for that reason. They need to invest in updating the graphics every few years apparently. (Spider Man was great at Islands of Adventure and that was updated recently) Jimmy Fallon was the clearest one at Universal.. We ate at The Leaky Cauldrin. It seems they want everyone to order with the app. It took us a bit of time to figure it out but it worked nicely. Butterbeer, $8 REALLY! The food there was okay. It was a nice place to cool off and have nice scenery. Wearing masks is very hard in the heat. Be aware. There were times when someone in our party felt ill due to it. The staff is great at cleaning. Great at reminders to distance. Since it was really empty, it was so easy to distance. We stayed at Surfside because it provided transportation and early entry. However, we found out that early entry is one park for a whole week. It was Universal Studios all week. So do not pay the extra if you want the extra hour until you know which park will have this when you visit. We visited Volcano Bay, amazing place without crowds on August 26. Islands of Adventure 27, 28 and no lines until later in day Friday. No need for Express tickets. Loved Islands of Adventure!! Also, there are areas where concessions are shut down. We just wanted water once and could not find a place. Loved they have lockers at each ride for free. Without crowds it was great. Could see it being annoying if you had to wait in lines to go to lockers and pick up stuff.

title: GET EXPRESS PASSES!
review_text: We spend 3 days at Universal and it was amazing! First day we didn‚Äôt do the express passes but decided by the second day to do it. We were SO happy we did! Got through the rides so fast. ONLY downside is not seeing the cool stuff you see while waiting in line (mostly the Harry Potter stuff) Express passes we‚Äôre kinda expensive but well worth it for us. Universal was so detailed and fun. Very glad we went and will definitely go back!

title: Loved the Harry Potter Attractions!
review_text: Overall, lots of fun, but make sure you get the two-park pass and take the Hogwarts Express between the two parks. This "ride" is a hoot@

title: Great place to go
review_text: I love universal ! It‚Äôs just amazing üòâ The rides are out of this world and the experience is Fabulous We have been twice on two different occasions and different times of year Feb half term for uk is good as it‚Äôs quiet And queues are not too bad Food in the park is decent The security Q can be long but that‚Äôs fine!

title: Great rides, something for everyone.
review_text: A park with something for everyone. From nostalgic shoot-em up's in Men In Black to the Minions ride at the entrance of the park. The rides are kept in great condition and I rode many multiple times as they are that fun. The food choice is good, I would recommend a trip to Moe's Tavern in the Simpsons section of the park for a 'Flamin' Moe'. It is definitely worth getting one of the refillable freestyle bottles as the stations are all across the park and you will drink a lot of fluids due to the heat. If you have park hopper, definitely jump on the Harry Potter train to do so as its fun/interactive and the journey changes depending what park you are coming from/going to. Also recommend the purchase of the fastpasses. These work on almost all the rides except one or two and are good for the whole day. You'll normally get on around 8-10 rides if you really try per day whereas I was getting on around 20 with the fastpass.

title: visit
review_text: We went to eat at bubba Gump but ended up eating at margaritiville. Had a great time and voodoo donuts is amazing

title: Pointless to go with COVID restrictions even with short lines!
review_text: So we purchased the Florida Resident Season Passes and Volcano Bay as an add on. All I can say is it's POINTLESS to go! While the lines were not very long the COVID "precautions" are ridiculous! For example Shrek 3D has 30 seats but they load only 7! They literally show you the seating on the entrance sign to the ride so I am NOT exaggerating... Therefore, it takes more than 4 times as long to move through the line! We arrived just after 11:00am and only managed to do Shrek 3D, Hogwarts Train to Adventure Island, Eat a quick (late lunch), and go on Jurrasic Park River Adventure - then the park was closing! 6:00pm! Most of our time was spent in line with Universal (Nazi) staff yelling at more than a few people to "cover your nose" as just wearing the mask was insufficient even when we were all seperated by more than 6 feet (as shown in every line with stickers on the floor). Anyway, save your money until the park fully opens otherwise I suggest just skipping it totally!!!!

title: Social distancing largely ignored during COVID-19
review_text: My wife and I went to Islands of Adventure and found that social distancing was largely ignored. The rides seem to be a bit better, but people can't seem to read where the social distance line is and stop piling on top of you. A couple of the rides weren't even wiped down after people exited the ride. We thought the access to the parks were supposed to be limited at this time, but that did not appear to be the case. Universal should take a hint from Disney and keep people who are drinking and eating stationary. The wait times for rides were ridiculous. You really can't get on most without a long wait unless you spend the extra money for the express pass. The Hulk coaster had an 85 minute wait 2 hours after the park opened. Hagrid's ride was a 2 hour wait. We are Florida residents and probably won't go back for a while.

title: pretty good
review_text: Lines were fairly short and rides were easy to get on. The park was pretty much empty and the normal game attractions were empty for long periods of time. I don't think Universal needs that booth that is trying to offer time share to people in the park. Maybe they could have a booth with just a computer for people if they would like to see someone about this. I saw the people at the time share become very pushy. I understand it is sales. Right now people are just trying to keep their heads above water.  The tickets weren't good to go from theme park to Diagnon alley. So we couldn't ride any of those rides. It required another payment of $55. per adult. Don't know if kids price was cheaper. Was a real bummer.  Volcano bay. Was very pretty, but lacked signs for lockers, and the mask wearing issues was very tough. You had to have a mask to get a drink or order food in the park, but did not need it for rides. Where the heck are you supposed to keep your mask? on your lounge chair it will just blow away. The other thing is they were supposed to have cages for service animals while the people were on a ride, and they told us they could provide us one so our dogs could be safe. Why aren't there like areas to take your service dog. They are supposed to be with us? Why isn't there a place for them and their owners? Dogs would like to cool down also.  In general the parks were very good about getting water for our service dogs. The warm concrete was hard on them as we couldn't get boots prior to the trip. The dogs rode the carasol with us.

title: Good Time!
review_text: Universal << Disney  That being said, Universal is still fun and Harry Potter World is EXTREMELY good. Harry Potter World is well worth the prices of admission.  Some of the other areas in the parks are pretty outdated and will need to be changed soon otherwise people will stop going.  Another thing I noticed was that Universal struggles to create a special experience in the same way that Disney does. It definitely isn't easy to do.

title: Lots of fun
review_text: A fun and enjoyable experience. About as much activity as you can cram into one day, 2 days would be better.

title: It was nice and cool
review_text: They need to have more discounts for the tickets More bath rooms They need there bus to the park more different rides to experience

title: Overboard on Masks
review_text: I know that universal has to do what they need to do to open and stay open, but the mask nazis are needing to take it down a notch. No more than getting through the gate at opening, I simply ask my wife whixh direction we are headed and scratched an itch on my nose. The mask came down just under my nose for no more than a second before I re-adjusted it "correctly" over my nose and was immediately and very rudely confronted by an employee. The rudeness of the employees at most rides on our trip was uncalled for. Some of the employees were very nice and courteous, but are outnumbered by the bad. In the 90+ degree heat the masks are already hard to deal with, but having that plus the employees attitudes is uncalled for. The hand sanitizer they require you use before each ride leaves a residue after until you wash your hands thoroughly to remove it. I DO NOT recommend attending until this "pandemic" is over and NO MASKS are required.

title: Nice get away
review_text: We stayed at Lowe‚Äôs Royal Pacific Hotel which is amazing. We have encountered nothing but wonderful helpful people from our hotel to our stay at the parks. Daily temperature checks, hand sanitizer before every ride and of course mask through out. We have experienced a couple of technical difficulties. For someone reason my food app works everywhere but at leaky cauldron and 3 broomsticks. But again, someone was right there to help. The photo pass has given some difficulty adding and activating but again very kind and helpful people. If you are from Louisiana like us, do yourself a favor and bring salt or Tony‚Äôs. I hope to come back soon.

title: Kudos
review_text: Good job Universal with all your hard work during this pandemic. I wasn't sure if I would feel safe coming to the parks but now I do. I would say about 75% off people were wearing their masks correctly but I would hear cast members reminding those guests that were not to cover their nose and mouth. Cast members were constantly wiping down handrails . Thank you for keeping us safe.

title: Terrible customer service
review_text: A few attendants ruined the overall experience for my family and I. I‚Äôm aware that masks are essential at the moment, but the nature of which they treated us was uncalled for. At one point I had been taking a sip of my bottled beverage while waiting in line and the attendant scolded me for doing so. She said that if I couldn‚Äôt keep my mask on, I‚Äôll wouldn‚Äôt be allowed to enter the ride. I was shocked. I apologized and said I was under the impression there was a 30 second drinking rule that I had been following. She snippily replied ‚ÄúWell I don‚Äôt know about that, but you‚Äôll keep it on or be removed.‚Äù I did as she said, but this is not the experience I signed up for. I understand bad days/rude customers, and how it can take a toll on someone, but this strict attitude was consistent throughout the park. Then we were approaching the line for Shrek, my dad took a sip of his water and immediately placed his mask back up, while to my left another male let his mask hang down completely, and yet she only got onto my father who was actively trying to adhere to the rules. I don‚Äôt want to cry racism, but she saw both men and chose to get onto the minority:/ Both people should be held to the same standard. There were more instances of just overall rude/wrong behavior, but for now this is all I‚Äôm going to write about. I really hope Universal goes to better lengths to ensure their customer service is up to par because as of now I am thoroughly disappointed.

title: Disappointing
review_text: Sorry to write that we had a disappointing day: 1. Crowds were horrendous. Unlike Disney which requires a reservation and therefore crowds are manageable, Universal doesn't have any limits and their current "buy a day, get the rest of the year for free" promotion for Floridians is packing the parks with locals. Look for 30-75 minute waits for the most popular rides 2. After ordering simple chicken sandwiches at Mel's DriveIn we waited 27 minutes only to be told that they're still not ready. We cancelled order and moved on- having wasted half an hour 3. The new ride Hagrid's Motorbike was down the entire day (Friday, 8/14) 4. Unhelpful staff. We asked how to get to the Bourne Stunt show are were told, "that's not here, that's in California." Wrong. 5. Not enough shade, misters, and air conditioning for 90 degree humid weather 6. Not your fault, but the 6 foot rule has made lines even longer and pushed them out into the hot humid Florida weather

title: Fun fun fun
review_text: Great for teenagers and adults compared to Disney. Giving 4/5 as rides were having issues all the time. But it was fun still.

title: Good park, but doable in a day
review_text: We're big Disney fans and were staying on resort there, but thought we'd do two days across the Universal parks. It's easy and convenient to get a Lyft over to the parks, and we had a great day in the park. There's a good range of rides to try, but overall we always found the theming and general vibe of the park is more like a 'theme park' than to the calibre of experience at Disney. In my experience over several visits across the year, it's never worth getting the Express pass if you time you visit and rides well (or certainly it's not worth getting in advance until you see the real park crowds on that day). We enjoyed our visit and wouldn't advise anyone against going, but if you're at Disney it's a lot of money to spend in addition to take time away and I'm not sure how worth it this is. The difficulty being that the tickets only become cheaper when you buy multiple days, but there isn't enough to do in the parks to warrant more than one day per Universal park if you're hopping between.

title: Amazing time
review_text: We did the Wizarding World of Harry Potter Package July 25-28th. Found the staff to be super helpful and friendly. The face masks were a minor inconvenience but in no way interfered with the fun experience the parks offered. I felt that the safety of my family was a high priority to each member of the staff both at the parks and the Endless Summer Surfside Resort, where we stayed. Although we didn't use them enough, the You Rest Area's were a great way to relax without a mask. Due to COVID-19 the crowds were smaller and we were able to ride every ride we wanted to several times, giving my grandchildren an amazing first experience. Can't wait to return.

title: Had A Universal time
review_text: Social distancing, hand sanitizer, and facial covering is required for all attendees. Parking is free anytime after 6:00 P.M. Free boat ride to all guest after 8:30 P.M. Live entertainment, great food, and bathrooms are clean constantly especially, during this (COVID)-19

title: lots of fun, noy very crowded, lots of social distancing, felt safe the entire time.
review_text: lots of fun, noy very crowded did IOA and universal in the same day rode all the atractions some twice, lots of social distancing, felt safe the entire time, friendly employees. just an awsome time.

title: Lots to do
review_text: We really enjoyed Universal Studios Orlando with my teenagers. There are a number of attractions for all ages. If you're staying for multiple days I would encourage you to get a pass to go between the parks. You also need a two-park pass if you want to ride the Harry Potter train.
