If you are with teenagers you don't want to miss The Mummy. The new Borne Stunttacular is the best I have ever seen with special effects don't miss that either.

title: Last minute decision to do park
review_text: Enjoyed Universal‚Äôs studio even with the safety guidelines in place. The crowd was very aware and followed guidelines. Crew members was making sure hands were sanitized before entering the ride. I felt safe and still able to enjoy. The wait times seem longer than they actually were.

title: Honeymoon extravaganza
review_text: Went to Orlando for a honeymoon extravaganza in August 2019 involving Universal Studios, all Disney parks, SeaWorld, A Manatee Expedition and Busch Gardens. Universal was absolutely amazing, beautiful scenery, well maintained rides, helpful staff and not unreasonable wait times if you plan carefully (made more bareable by fans and air con in the queues!) We even got an extra go on the new Hagrid Ride after a looong queue as it was our honeymoon which was great! Loved the Harry Potter section, being British it is exactly how I would have pictured it, Hogsmeade, Diagon Alley and Hogwarts Castle and the entertainment there were wonderful! Would definitely recommend but plan carefully to avoid long queues!

title: Masks and Amusement Parks don‚Äôt mix!
review_text: I would not go to Universal Studio Parks until they stop requiring people to wear masks at ALL times. It was horrible!! We wore our masks as instructed, and our family was mask-shamed by employees even when we took our masks off to eat/drink or breathe. Not to mention it was way too hot to wear a mask! We are medical professionals, and there was no need to wear a mask in a 1/2 empty amusement park outside when it is almost 100 degrees. It causes more harm than good. #FactsOverFear

title: Fun and Easy
review_text: The Harry Potter rides and exhibits were definitely our favorites, from Escape from Gringotts, to the ride inside Hogwarts, to Hagrid's Motorcyle rides. But there's a lot more to enjoy at Universal Studios, too. The Bourne Stunt show was simply amazing, a seamless integration of live action and CGI that left us wondering when one ended and the other began. Even for adults, the Shrek and Minion shows were a delight.  For those who are wondering, everyone wore masks, and the people in line practiced social distancing. The employees were constantly cleaning and spritzing hand sanitizer on everyone's hands before each ride. Everyone also had their temperature taken before going into the park. My family felt as safe as one can in these strange times.

title: Good
review_text: I visited the park with my husband and 3 kids yesterday. Before that I visited the park with my husband 15 years ago and liked it much better now. There weren't many people at the park which meant little or no wait time at all. We were able to do most of the rides twice. Please mind that the park opens at 9am and closes at 5pm. I wish it would close later. Wearing a mask is a must,hand sanitaizer before every ride,temperature check before entering the park. No paper map, you have to download their app. Harry Potter part was our favorite. My 2 year old could do only 2 shows. Most of the kids zone is closed( mini water park and Curious George part).It was a problem to find turkey legs. Overall we had a great day.The only negative is that one day at the Universal studios costs a fortune. Paid around $140 per ticket. The food package per person is $35 which includes water bottle( unlimited drinks) one meal and a snack. We stayed at the hotel across the street from Universal( very convenient).

title: Great time
review_text: Hardly nobody visiting and getting in early was an plus. Few lines and interaction with others was super. The Irish pub Fennigans was delish! Street actors were adorned and easily watched.

title: Bad and slow food service
review_text: The service at the quick service restaurants is terrible now with the new procedures in place. It will take at least 20 minutes after you order to get the food. Even longer if you have to pay cash at the register since they really don‚Äôt like that. There‚Äôs also a line just to get into the restaurant with no option to take it to go. Eat at the fire eaters grill in ioa as it‚Äôs the only place that doesn‚Äôt do these things although you will have to eat outside. Universal needs to stand up against fear and do things using common sense.

title: Family fun
review_text: Our trip to universal Studios was very awesome the characters and the rides was great.seeing spiderman. dinosaur s and all different characters you can imagine.

title: Excellent Team Members = Epic Vacation
review_text: Stayed at Universal's Adventura Hotel this past weekend with my family and had a great time visiting Volcano Bay for the first time and enjoying the parks as always. Universal has been doing an excellent job in creating a safe environment during COVID and making sure guests have an incredible experience.  Most of all, I want to recognize two team members that went above and beyond for us this past trip. First of all, shout out to Savannah who worked the register at Urban Pantry in the Aventura hotel. She provided us excellent service and went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of -- even though we came right before closing for the night. She really made us hungry and tired guests quite welcome and she should be recognized!  The second team member I want to shout out is Scott over at the Hollywood Drive-in Mini Golf. When we were deciding whether to golf before dinner at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., he advised us to come back once it got dark and gave us some great tips as well as a voucher for a free appetizer for the restaurant. His overall cheerful and helpful attitude made for some excellent customer service skills that should be recognized.  Universal's Team Members are some of the best around! Thank you for your great service!

title: Great fun for the whole family
review_text: Definitely the best part about all of the experience At Universal Studios Orlando is the fact that you can pretty much go anywhere and they keep the park very nice neat clean and they also do really good safe upkeep of making sure customers feel safe with everything going on through COVID-19. If you‚Äôre gonna be in town or for any length of time and you‚Äôre gonna come by definitely consider upgrading your tickets at the customer service window before you come in and get the season pass now I do you save money everywhere you go during the time that you‚Äôre at the park you also save money at all the stores for merchandise.The rides are exceptional and extremely enjoyable

title: Amazing
review_text: Not as good as disney world in my opinion. Still amazing all the same. Love the mummy ride, and the men in black ride, as well as everything else! But those are my two favourites. The horror makeup show is a great laugh and I love that you can get a duff beer in the park. Its a must do!

title: Universal during Covid ...
review_text: Given that our entire lives have been taken over by Covid-19, and the constant onslaught of media attention covering the surge of cases in Flordia, to say I was conflicted about going to Universal Studios in an understatement. Ultimately, my family of 7 decided to go. We even flew there. Here is what I learned and how we controlled for as much risk as possible...  Airport...We decided to avoid shuttles and shared spaces as much as possible. We also bought double-layered masks for extra protection. We parked in self-parking, which allowed us to walk into the terminal without taking a shuttle.  In the airport, we were able to keep 6 feet or more distance at all times. Traffic is low, so this was easy. Rather than sitting at our own gate, we sat at the next one over (which was empty ) to stay away from others.  Once on the plane, which was only half full, we asked if we could move to the back two rows. There were at least two empty rows ahead of those, so we again felt we successfully maintained distance.  Upon arriving at Universal, we rented our own car and set off to Universal's Surfside hotel. The hotel was at less than a third capacity. We were the only ones in our hallway.  Pools got a little busy at night, but still very manageable.  Rather than take the free shuttles from the hotel the next morning, we asked the front desk if we could park at one of the closer resort hotels for the day. We explained we were just trying to reduce our risk. They allowed us to do this. So we parked at the Royal Pacific hotel each day and walked the private path up to universal. Again, not sharing bus rides was nice.  At the park. Universal does an excellent job with spacing and hand sanitizer going on to the rides. They keep distance between rows on the actual rides by allowing every other row to be empty or by separating groups by car. You are never riding with a stranger.  We felt most at risk getting off of rides and departing the Hogwarts Express. While they take such care getting you on rodes safely and separately; it is a free-for-all after the rides. I wish they would have controlled that part better.  Also, the locker situation is probably the riskiest part. There is no way to not need lockers. Some rides even require that you leave your phone. I wish they would change that. I could easily leave my bag, but you need the phone to book virtual line passes. Even though they try to space out access to the lockers, these are tight spaces that are touched by everyone. The easiest fix is to allow people to keep their phones and to recommend all bags to be left in lockers.  The dining facilities are mostly mobile order. Groups are well spaced, and outdoor seating is available. Mealtime was a great chance for a safe mask break.  We are now home and we are quarantining. I have read that at the earliest, we could take a Covid test after 5 days for 60% accuracy. There is still a 40% possibility of a false negative. We will likely take a test on day 5, results usually take 2-3 days and we will decide from there.  The isolation is hard, especially on kids. Our kids play with the neighbors a lot, and now we are watching them out the window. However, I do take seriously my responsibility to not spread the virus if we have it. I hope they come up with more accurate tests that can detect the virus sooner. Most people are not going to self-quarantine unless they know they have it.  In sum, we had a great time, and if you are ok with controlling for all the variables that you can, wearing a mask all day, and responsibility quarantining when you get back...I say go. We walked on rides all 4 days. It was pretty awesome to get to see and experience Harry Potter world and the rest of the attractions at a leisurely pace.  FYI...NO FAST PASS NEEDED...I wouldn't waste the money on a more expensive stay at the more expensive resorts, Surfside is the best deal by far.

title: In the current environment, STAY HOME!
review_text: Let me start off by saying that due to the pandemic, I am awarding 1 extra star to my reviews due to the difficult situation. Universal has improved on a number fo their rides but the draconian attitude by some of their employees made this a miserable vacation. I'll excuse the fact that most of the employees we encountered were just plain rude but there were a few stand outs such as Robert, the team leader at Bank of Gringnots who jumped in front of my wife (violating social distancing guidelines) taking a picture screaming that face masks were required at all times. We tried to explain that we already asked and were told it would be OK provided we kept in mind social distancing guidelines and did it quickly. Robert though remained in our face even when requested to step back and threatened to have us removed from the park if we took anymore pictures. There were others during our visit who we observed who treated guests just as Robert treated us. The hand Sanitizer used at Universal before the rides smells awfully strong of gasoline and is like rubbing snot on your hands. My youngest son hands started to peel and burn after the 3rd day. When we asked if we could apply our own sanitizer (which exceeds recommended requirements), we were told we were not and that failure to apply it could result in being removed from the park. The rudeness of Universal employees plus the disgusting hand sanitizer is a instant zero in my book. The two stars comes from Volcano Bay and the fact that masks were not required and employees were not behaving like Masks Nazis. People kept their distance and enjoyed themselves. As for the main parks, I won't say that we won't return but it will be a long while before I do...

title: Outstanding Customer Service
review_text: Called today to make a hotel reservation and spoke with RANIA in Reservations. She provided OUTSTANDING top-notch customer service, which is hard to come by these days. She was patient, willing to help answer all of our questions and went above and beyond in offering her help and support. We priced several different Universal properties, and ended making a reservation at our all-time favorite location - Sapphire Falls. But Rania helped us understand what each of the other properties offered and the pricing points of each. Thank you Rania for your help and professionalism.

title: Kids Birthday Surprise during COVID
review_text: I was highly satisfied with their safety precautions during the entire time there. Every ride we got on someone was wiping and spraying after every group.There are signs and everywhere about staying ft apart and there pretty vocal about it if you don't. We went there to surprise the kids for there birthday.This might sound crazy but going during COVID was pretty tight. Although some of the parades and shows was not going the lines to the ride wait was 20 mins at max. Only ride we wasn't able to make it to was the mummy it was virtual and speed pass only and it was all booked up so if you go download the app and virtually book that first.

title: Good experience, even during a pandemic
review_text: The objective report: Every, I mean EVERY safety precaution is in place. Temperatures taken before entering the hotel or park, wristbands to ensure you went through the temp checkpoint. The six feet distance requirement is serious business...if you're 5.75ft from the next party, a staff member will pop out from nowhere to kindly have you step back. Same with masks...cover nose to chin or you don't go in. Guests are extremely proactive and compliant, staff are kind but mean business. Our boat captain to the park stopped our ride because a kid had his mask on his chin. They are 100% on top of their game.  The perspective: Crowds were tiny in the mornings, no lines for anything except the new Jason Bourne show. This line stretched all the way down the street...UO might need to rethink this strategy as we showed up 3x to try to see the show but it was full every time so we gave up. Walked right onto Hagrid's motorcycle coaster, King King, and Escape from Gringott's.. We had an express pass with our hotel key, but it wasn't necessary as the morning crowd was so small. Heat and masks were fine before noon...afternoons were sweltering and miserable with increasing park crowds.  The verdict: Definitely glad we came, its a much needed respite. Personally, I loved the lack of crowds and spacing for the most part, it almost felt like we had the park to ourselves at times. If safety is the issue. I feel safer here than at my local supermarket. More precautions are taken, and there is a neverending supply of hand sanitizer.

title: Get some new Rides!!
review_text: Other than Rip Ride Rock-it, the Harry Potter area, and the Mummy, this half of the park is crap. Ditch the Simpsons ride, it‚Äôs awful, the fast and furious is junk, the transformers is ok, and the rest are for little kids. Add some more indoor coasters like the mummy to help people enjoy the park while the rain comes each day in the summer. The food is way over priced!

title: Great time, trip to Florida not wasted
review_text: My family and I were down in Ft. Lauderdale to attend a wedding. We thought that since we flew all the way down to Florida we might as well go to an amusement park. We chose Universal Studios for our visit and could not have had a better time. While Florida is hot even in October the park itself was a blast. All of the older attractions were well maintained and performed. Any of the new rides/experiences were certainly cutting edge. The actors were are very professional and since we bought the express pass our waits were not too long.

title: Universal Does Not Disappoint
review_text: We have been WDW APers for years but decided to also get UO passes as well since they offered 3 free months. Since we're blocked out until August at the other park, we decided to do a three day trip. The ease of getting the annual pass was a breeze and all CMs were pleasant and accommodating. It was my first time on a lot of rides (I visited once about 10 years ago), and Hagrid's did not disappoint. We were happy to get virtual queue passes to it, even when we did not arrive until almost lunchtime. One day we rode it about 4 times - although I will say that, on the fourth ride, the CM pulled us off the ride after we were seated to walk all the way back to the simulator to make sure someone in our party could fit into the seat. I find having to do this drill as everyone in the queue watched is unnecessarily humiliating - move it somewhere else! Social distancing was enforced and announcements were made while waiting in line as CMs using cameras could see when people removed their masks. We stayed at a hotel on property that was sub-par, but that's another review .. Definitely looking forward to using our passes again soon.

title: Great fun in the Florida sun!
review_text: It was a beautiful day in Florida with my family it was 5 like my grandchild and my handicap son they where the first set of questions and the second step of questions where how was this park going to handle covit 19 before we entered the park we got there about 9:00 in the morning we where all brite eyed and bushy tail some of us where. We started at the main garage heading up to park it cost 25 dollars to park for the day we did this for 5 days with tickets with water park option on tickets and our tickets had to be used consecutively no gaps in the week straight our the tickets our no good . we where told the rules in line at customer's the mains entrance of the and garage. Must where a mask at all times unless you go to the rest areas they or eat choose you can. take them off if child 1 to 3 did not have to where a mask but if you have medical condition you did not have to either like my one son who is handicap i had to where his special blue and white band show he does not have to where one .because of his conditions that and have to carry a handicap pass around. my neck to show on the rides but there is. a but in everything we do in life .it is you must where a mask in the main line of the ride you our standing for that is everyone handicap our not even on the ride it self. only for the area can they not where a. mask he did not.so all the rules out of way and checking in with tickets we started our way to islands of adventure .with marvel rides like doctor d doom,spiderman, hulk,great start of the day kids love the rides here lots of eye candy the water rides our good,and Harry Potter area with haggard's add to the. mix family's new favorites even staff where great through all this covit 19 .it was so safe no problems on our end here one of the best places for your handicap child or adult i can not say any thing else about this park great job with your help and customs training thankyou for always reaching out to the people's fo what i seen hope they keep with this care for the long hall thankyou universal. For giving my handicap son and family a good time we will be manny more times keep up the good work and safety of all customer's so everyone a must to always in Orlando. All i can people go out and have fun here

title: Terrible Service at Hagrid Ride
review_text: I've been to Universal Studios many times, but never have I been as disappointed as I was this last time. Many employees were very rude. I almost wanted to tell them that they needed to go to Disney World to get an etiquette lesson. I understand that employees may be overwhelmed with Covid, but not being able to treat your guests correctly is an issue. My family was 6-8 feet away from two people in front of us. The lady complained that my son did not have his mask on (he sneezed in his mask) because he took it off to wipe his nose. She told the Male worker at the Hagrid ride. The worker asked us for him to put it back on, which he was in the process of doing so. When we got to the hand sanitizer (after putting it on all day with zero issues with employees), my husband's hand was dry and he asked if he really had to have it. He wasn't mean about it. He was very nice. The girl told him yes, so he did. He put it in his hands and rubbed it in. She immediately said "sir, you wiped it off" and caused a fuss that was inexcusable. He told her that she could smell his hands and that it was wiped in. She continued to fuss loudly. The Male employee who previously asked for my Son's mask to be put back on (since he was wiping his nose from sneezing) came over and loudly TOLD US to get out of the line and we had to leave. We asked him why and he had zero answers besides being a jerk and telling us to get out of line loudly again. We asked for his name and he refused. We asked his manager for his name and she refused to give it. This is very unprofessional. We did end up riding the ride but to cause an inexcusable commotion was ridiculous. The staff was horrible. Had there been a serious issue, I wonder how they would have dealt with it, but they were horrible. The service was horrible the last day we were there as we were there for 4 days. I've never had treatment like this before at any Park and I cannot believe Universal would employ such horrible people.

title: Simple Winderful
review_text: Amazing, everyting about it is great. Transformers ride is superb, MIB also great, in fact it's all brilliant, Diagon Alley is by far the best. A must do when visiting Orlando

title: Sons vaca wasted.
review_text: I thought long and hard about this review. Do I post do I not?! Does it matter?! So here it is. The issue I have was the height for the rides. No no I am not wanting my child unsafe but I read the height requirements for my son as this was a trip for him since we did Disney for my daughter. He loves dinosaurs, super hero(hints the spider web in his hair in sport of Spider-Man), sharks, and more things interest him there than Disney. So I check and see most the rides I think he will enjoy and take note of the height requirements. I also take him to the doctor in February for his 4year old check up and made sure he was the height he needed to be before even thinking of booking and planning this vaca. Finally after knowing he was tall enough and knowing the cost we book a June vaca. Note I took him in February to the doctor and he was 1/4inch taller than what he needed to be and of course he only could grow as June approached! So we arrive and we did both parks and my son cried in sadness as I did too(while he wasn‚Äôt looking cause I walked away as my husband consoled him) but only out of rage that as a parent I did all I could to make this go as planned for him! At one point we went to the line that measured him and ok‚Äôd him but once we arrive to get on the ride they brought another measure stick and it was literally an inch different. I had one of the ride people walk back with me to the beginning of the line and we all saw the difference and she literally said ‚Äú you will Have to take this up with a manager as I am to go off this measure.‚Äù I was shocked as so was the other guest in line who witnessed this. This particular ride was the Popeyes water ride. I feel I wasted my money his trip wasn‚Äôt all it should be. I feel the park took something from us which is our great experience we should have been able to witness as parents and he live and remember as a child. We live 17hours away had to take 2 days to get there with the cost of a layover hotel and this place needs to keep that in mind and check that all of their ride measure sticks are correct and match their online postings. Also I think they should bring back the jaws ride. It is better than fast and the furious in my opinion which was one of the few he got to do.

title: Kudos to Universal for their COVID planning
review_text: Seems silly to write a review of such a well known place but this is worth taking the time to do. I don‚Äôt know if I have seen any other business taking COVID so seriously. I was not worried for my safety even once. They actually took our temperatures and took their time to look at them and look at us. They gave us hand sanitizer before EVERY ride and wiped everything down EVERY TIME! No noses sticking out of masks for guests or workers and they carefully seated everyone to keep social distancing. A+ Universal, we were impressed!!

title: Freaking awesome as always
review_text: Right now the wait times are nothing. If not scared of getting CV, now is time to come. The parks are super clean and they take the mask wearing seriously. We have watching people spray down everything multiple times daily. We normally stay at one of main resorts to get Express passes but switched to sapphire falls since not busy and saved tons of money. No need for Express most rides are walk ons even if they say 20 or 25min wait. The mummy usually says 20mins but it's a walk on. Hagrids is only one that is virtual line but throughout day can get multiple rides. We have ridden hagrids over 20 times this week. Insane.

title: Family visit
review_text: This was a family üë™ trip and the ages ran from 7 to 80 (me). I brought our own mobility scooters for my wife and I. That helped because there is a lot of walking üö∂. The park was not very crowded so that was nice. The old folks even road Spiderman and Jurassic Park. The only bummer was the shows were closed and for the price I was disappointed üòû.

title: Sublime experience.
review_text: How Can you rate something so unique and excellent as Universal Orlando resort.. It was Absolutely amazing, theillibg and breathtaking. We vane all the way from Dennark and will definitely come back. Second to none!

title: Awesome safe and clean trip during pandemic
review_text: We visited during the pandemic. I was highly impressed with all the staff was doing to make things safe. Lots of social distancing, staff are giving you sanitizer, they are cleaning rides. Crowd levels were pretty low for us at least. I felt pretty safe there and had a great time.

title: Excellent covid procedure!!
review_text: Universal did a great job with keeping the parks clean! Here are the things they did: - Morning parking is every other space, so when we got out of our car, we are distanced from other cars. Eventually the spots are filled, as there are cars next to us when we return. - temp check upon entry - Continuous disinfecting of moving walkway railings. There are people at one end of each walkway, continuously wiping the railings - 6ft social distance on most places - using ID (instead of fingerprints) for the ticket identification - virtual lines for long lines, so even if you wait, most of the waiting is outdoor. The queue move swiftly indoor, limiting the time spent in a crowd indoor - 12 ft distance on indoor queue, often skipping a row, so you are always at least 6ft away from other parties - mandatory hand sanitizer prior to boarding every ride - roller coaster: roughly 3 rows apart between parties - theater like seating (shrek, bourne, etc): at least 3 seats apart between parties and every other row seating - compartment ride (hogwarts express, gringotts, simpson, spiderman, etc): one compartment per party. - Rides are sprayed after every rides. - Most store doors are open to minimize touchings - door knobs, surfaces, railings are wiped often - order food via app and we take the plates from the tray to minimize touching - everybody wears masks inside the park - some decor are removed to provide more space for people - reduced crowd, I am not sure if this is intentional. There might be a crowd entering the park, but once inside, the crowd dispersed throughout the park.  We had a great time there and felt safe. Thank you Universal! We especially love the Wizarding World of Harry Potter, the low crowd really enabled us to enjoy the details of Hogsmeade & Diagon Alley.  And Bourne Stuntacular is really awesome! They just opened last week and it is a must see!  I hope this helps with your decision whether to go during this time!

title: Always a great time!
review_text: I‚Äôve been going since a little girl and it‚Äôs always the best experience. I‚Äôve seen this place transform over those years in so many ways and it only gets better and better. Due to COVID my trips have slowed, and events have been cancelled but that‚Äôs okay because they do a great job keeping you connected and in the loop. I went recently after the state lockdown and while it did feel a little weird, they did an amazing job ensuring guest wore their mask properly, social distancing was in full effect and the trip was still just as fun as ever. Wait times weren‚Äôt too long and the cleaning and disinfecting after rides or throughout public areas were on point!! I always do Universal first then head over to islands for the more thrilling rides.

title: Not the best for Big/Tall people
review_text: I‚Äôm a larger fellow sitting at around 5‚Äô11 and weighing around 300lbs. Many of the thrill rides were inaccessible to me. I spent thousands between tickets and hotels and food and transportation and when I asked for a partial refund because I couldn‚Äôt access nearly any of the rides I was interested in I was told that because it was so late in the day they were unable to help me. But it took nearly the whole day walking around and waiting In line to even find out that I was too big for the rides in the first place!

title: Loved our quiet time..
review_text: Stayed at the Sapphire Falls, great choice, and easy access to the parks by boat. Purchased a 3-day pass and for 2 of us around $600.  June 8th was the first of 3 days. Was nice having a ticket where we could bounce back and forth between the two for 3-days.  Just opened I believe a few days prior. May have been a bit more chaotic..so new for everyone and having to deal with COVID. Precautions were taken everywhere....everyone was masked up and hand sanitizer at every turn.  I have not been to Universal since they first opened...so yes, things have defiantly changed. We did enjoy the parks being quiet, with the heat and having to wear a mask, at times it got a little overwhelming.  Many attractions have very little wait times, so nice. The downfall of COVID, parks closed early (I believe there was a curfew in effect also). We are huge Disney people and night time is the best...so we were looking forward to all the lights of the evening hours. No parades and much of the other entertainment was canceled. But still, much to do and see. As time goes...I am sure more this will open  This was a last-minute trip, because all of our other choices kept on getting canceled. I did not get to do any research in this area...but I am still glad we got to see and enjoy Universal.  My only real "huge" gripe. and this pertains to attraction anywhere....WHY do you feel the need to charge SO much for water.... I know you have fountains. ...but warm water and not the best tasting üòû.

title: Need to hire more adults
review_text: Most of the rides they did good at keeping 6 ft apart. Except Jimmy Fallon escape from New York. Multiple kids working there said to stay 3 feet apart! I of course moved 6 ft from person in front of me and young girl working told me to move closer, needs to be 3 feet away. I tried to explain safe distance is 6 feet but she didn‚Äôt listen or care. I was amazed in today‚Äôs environment multiple kids running the ride thought 3 feet was the requirement. This is too important to have teenagers running the place. With all the unemployment in the state, can‚Äôt they hire more adults?

title: OK
review_text: We bought military universal tickets $204 an adult for both parks and it was OK, the first day and yes social distancing was in full force. The food app. doesn't work in every restaurant a fast pass was useful it wasn't to crowded. The next day was better but for what I paid the fun just wasn't like universal fun. I 'd recommend waiting unless you want lots of peace and quite.

title: Great visit!!
review_text: We did the two parks in one day with three teenage boys and had a blast. It wouldn't have been possible to get that accomplished if the crowds were normal (non-Covid time). The park did a good job of keeping everyone safe and distanced while still providing a fun environment.  All of the Harry Potter rides were amazing and so much fun. There wasn't a thing we did all day that we didn't enjoy. Really glad we still made the trip.

title: Fast Pass check out date
review_text: Had Fass Pass from the Hard Rock Hotel.These are suppose to be good up to and on the day of check out. On our day of check out we stowed our bags and headed to the park. The first ride was to be the HULK coaster. Showed the Fast Pass Hard Rock Room card and the attendant said it was expired and took the card and told me to go to guest services if I wanted to "get ahead of the line" as if I had done something wrong manner.Needless to say lost 2 hrs park time lost doing the social distancing thing while wondering what went wrong. Long story short also it rained half the day so we missed alot of new rides because of someones error. I have saved alot and sacrificed alot to make this vacation happen for my family and park personnel seem to not care one bit.

title: Great time at Universal
review_text: My family and I enjoyed a wonderful time at both Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. Both theme parks did an excellent job with social distancing and ensuring people wore their masks in a friendly reminder sort of way. There was no overcrowding. They offered virtual lines for some of the more popular rides like Hagrid‚Äôs Motorbike Adventure but that too was great as we just showed up at our self chosen time and proceeded to the ride. While the line was long when we returned to this one particular ride it was very very quick. Each ride operator delivered each rider with a fresh pump of hand sanitizer prior to getting on the ride. I felt both parks did an excellent job of offering a great experience with germ control! FYI I am very particular when in comes to cleanliness and both parks exceeded my expectations. So grab your mask and head out to the parks and enjoy a day in the Florida sunshine once again.  Me and my family can‚Äôt wait to go back!

title: Anniversary trip to USO
review_text: This trip was taken shortly after USO reopened during the Covid19 pandemic. The whole facility and staff made sure that EVERYTHING was sanitized and clean. Face masks are required and temp checks are done before you step foot in the park. Some stores and events were shut down but that was understandable. The longest we had to wait for a ride was 55 mins which was the Kong ride, all others were less than 20 mins. Spent a lot of time in WWoHP as we usually do and never get bored. Didn‚Äôt get to ride Hagrids ride as a bad lightning storm rolled in. The only thing we didn‚Äôt like was the shorter operation hrs (9-7). We understood why though. All in all, USO and IoA is an amazing vacation spot and can‚Äôt wait to return.

title: Always fun!
review_text: Additional procedures for safety very good, some guests could use reminders about masks being on. Overall felt safe and had a lot of fun.

title: IMMACULATE AND NOT CROWDED
review_text: We are a family with adult children. All of us are fortunate survivors of mild cases of coronavirus. As a celebration of our good health, we spent the July 4 weekend at Universal Orlando and Islands of Adventure. Both were immaculate. Yes the face masks and hand sanitizer can be a pain, but they are necessary to keep everyone at the parks safe. We thought the staff did great in enforcing safety measures. Lines were short and the parks weren't crowded! We had a perfect weekend enjoying most of our favorite attractions and those wonderful Harry Potter fish 'n chips.

title: Hot with masks
review_text: 2nd trip since reopening. (Annual pass holders) Visited over 4th weekend. Lots of hand sanitizer and 6ft markers and always have ur mask on...got the cooling covers u can wear around ur neck that keep u cool and we soaked them in ice water occasionally which helped with the heat, because honestly from 8am until noon was all we could endure with masks in the FL heat-I dunno how the employees tolerate it. We hit the pools mid day. And sadly since the parks are closing early it wasn‚Äôt worth getting changed and going back to the park for our express passes that start at 4pm...we have basically lost that perk, previously we had 5-6 hrs express pass. We did enjoy an almost empty park. And thanks for the AP line-this needs to stay. No shade if ya wanted to line up for Bourne, so with a mask on in the heat-couldn‚Äôt do it. Why does this NOT have a virtual line? Overall we always have fun here. Enjoyed Sunday morning in an almost empty park.

title: Not for Individuals of Stature
review_text: Be forewarned, if you are a person size, as I am, you will not be able to ride 50% of the rides. I can ride every ride at WDW without issue, the rides at Universal were made for people no taller the 5' 6" and under 250 lbs. If you are outside of those dimensions you are out of luck as far as rollercoasters, or strap in rides go. It's a shame their main competitor can accommodate individuals of all shapes and sizes, but Universal decides to cut out people of size. If you have a choice, go elsewhere.

title: Looking run down and outdated
review_text: Universal needs a face lift. Buildings looked ‚Äútired‚Äù. Park attendance was minimal, hardly any one walking around. I guess because everyone else was at Harry Potter land in Islands of Adventure. Universal looked very much like a concrete fair. Not many rides which interested me. Was disappointed in atmosphere.

title: Just a day at City Walk
review_text: First let me say that there should be separate parking costs to just walk through City Walk if you don't plan on going to the theme parks but anyway. Nothing was really open when we arrived. Yes it was during COVID-19 so I wasn't surprised but I felt like I wasted money on parking. MASKS ARE REQUIRED, there are sanitizing stations throughout and temperature checks. I appreciated the staff enforcing proper masks wearing as well. You could only pull the mask down while eating or drinking. We thought maybe we would go to Islands of Adventure but with the Florida heat plus masks - we will try that again hopefully next year.

title: Universal Studios was unbelievable!!! üòä
review_text: Universal Studios We were there when the park first opened with all the Covid 19 measures in place. I work as a NP and I was very impressed!! There was always someone cleaning and sanitizing on every attraction. Note: Face masks are required!  I highly suggest staying at one of the on site hotels. We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel and it was very convenient walking to the park or catching a boat! We also were able to enter the park early. At the time we were there, a 7:00pm curfew was in place. Check before you arrive and try to make reservations especially for dinner.  Download the app so you can schedule ride times. I would also get the dual park ticket option.  We had a fantastic time and sincerely hope you will too!  Safe travels!

title: Great time to visit
review_text: We didn't wait longer than 30 minutes to ride any ride. Crowds are small due to the fear of covid. This made it great for us, as we were able to ride every ride in both parks, some twice, in a day and a half. They do require face coverings which was the downside. It is hot and uncomfortable wearing them. They have employees walking around monitoring that will tell you to get your mask up over your nose. You are also required to use hand sanitizer before boarding every ride. If you're not worried, now is the time to go.

title: Safe and Well Organized
review_text: We spent a fun filled day following UA‚Äôs strict social distancing guidelines. They are running at 1/4 capacity to avoid crowding. All the rides are open. The only negative was the horrid fast-food burger and fries we ate at one of their app places. We were under the impression that these were the only we could use but it was an erroneous impression since many sit-down restaurants and food trucks started to open up after twelve but it was too late. The app should strive to explain that the fast-food was not the only choice.

title: Deserves a day in your life!
review_text: We enjoyed visiting this park, even during the Covid crisis. It was not crowded as capacity was limited. With three kids including a four year-old we were able to enjoy pretty much all there is to do and see. Wearing a mask and adhering to the health and safety protocols we felt pretty safe. The Hollywood roller coaster is an absolute must.

title: The best park in the world.
review_text: Only one of the best places to go and visit without a doubt since, as they say in the other opinions they have seen so far, it is fantastic because it has the attractions of most of the movies and some for Children, Youth, and even adults.

title: COVID-19 Break
review_text: My favorite part of this attraction was how safe I felt being in the park amid the COVID-19 pandemic. They ensured that people wore mask and sanitized their hands before and after each ride. We were able to get on rides w/out extreme waits in line as the number of patrons was not excessive.

title: Ridiculously expensive
review_text: The park is super cool with great attractions. Ridiculously priced though, they nickel and dime you for everything. It's crazy lockers $2. To ride certain things. Drinks food all of it is insanely expensive. They need more shaded areas too. The mask requirement thing during Covid 19 is beyond annoying. Staff is very customer friendly though.

title: Photos with Transformers
review_text: As part of our family holiday we visited Universal Studios and loved it. having visited the Shrek, Minions and Simpsons ride we queued for the Transformers ride. I loved it. A hug transformer fan I had my photo taken with Optimus Prime and then Bumble Bee came out. My favourite, I was caught up in the whole magic. I cannot fault any of the rides, but Transformers was my favourite. We enjoyed some ice cream and bought some souvenirs, the photos are really overpriced, but the staff will take photos with your phone and /or camera if you ask. I did buy some of the photos as souvenirs.

title: Wonderful experience even with a mask!
review_text: What a blast!! First time at the park! My family appreciated the obvious efforts of the staff to keep the park sanitized and covid safe. The patrons seemed respectful of the rules and guidelines. Lines all moved swiftly. Such a great experience.

title: A Disney Lover Is Pleasantly Surprised!
review_text: We felt so safe here beause they are so diligent about wearing masks, using hand sanitizer before entering each ride, social distancing, and cleaning. There were team members everywhere standing by to answer questions also. We had purchased the express pass and one day two park ticket. We were able to get on every ride we wanted and eat breakfast and lunch by 1:30, and we reallt didn't need the Express pass except that we were trying to do both parks in 9 hours. We were in Orlando for a long weekend with only one day at Universal and one at Legoland, but I would certainy recommend you spend a more leisurely day at each of the three parks. We had heard reports of difficulty using mobile ordering, but at the Leaky Cauldron and the multi-food place in Springfield, we were escorted to our table by a TM who helped us mobile order. The highlight was the single family experience at Ollivander's. My grandson was able to have the full wand experience by signing up for a timeslot, so someone in your party is guarenteed to be picked. Although there are a few rides I would skip (Fast and Furious, Shrek 4D, ) most were fun. We loved the Gringott's ride, the interactive wand stations, and Men in Black. We also loved the characters that were stationed everywhere, either on floats or platforms.

title: Amazing!
review_text: My partner and I were here a couple of years ago and were blown away. Universal Studios is significantly better than all of Disney. The rides and experiences are phenomenal, especially the vr rides. Would 100 percent recommend spending a few days here!

title: Good times in ‚Äúthese times‚Äù
review_text: Great experience! Hardly any wait on rides. EVERYONE had masks. Staff was friendly and greeted us with hand sanitizer before entering any ride and ALWAYS reminded to pull masks up to cover nose etc. seriously I washed my hands a gazillion times per park policy. Lots of distancing and sanitizing observed.  Kids playground area was closed, but rides were operating. Lots of food stations had limited hours.  We enjoyed our experience and would recommend going now. Lots of memories made and had a blast. Walked through rows and rows of what would be wait lines sooo ya... now was a good time to go for us.

title: Universal was just OK
review_text: Our trip to Universal Studios was ok just average, I definitely think it would of been better without all Covid stuff going on as we had to wear a mask the whole time in the hot humid air however they do have sections where you can take a break from your mask. One thing that bothered me is that they do not do a good job explaining how things work there such as their app, we bought the tickets at the booth and the lady in the both was only interested in trying to up sale us. Hindsight I thought this is where she could of at least told us about the phone app that you can do many things on. I think if I would of known about the phone app right from the get go our experience would of been better. I will say that the staff did a great job with the social distancing they have it down and made us feel safe. One other thing they should update you on before you pay admission is what attractions are closed we were disappointed by this because we were looking forward to seeing everything! So in all they need to work on their communication other then that the park is fun and like I said if all the Covid stuff was not going on I think it would of been a lot better.

title: Great parks and the VIP tour is wonderful for those with limited time (Ask for Paul)
review_text: We just got back from a Florida trip and had a great time at Universal on June 14th. As we had limited time, we did the VIP group tour. I did the VIP group tour a year ago and compared to post-Covid, the experience was just as fun. If you are on limited time (say you can only spend a day at the parks), the VIP is a great option.  VIP sounds pricey, but when you add in all the benefits it's worth it. It's not just a fast pass, you're literally given front of line access to every ride during the tour (even on a slow day this will save hours of time). You also get breakfast and a full lunch included (starter, meal, dessert).  The main differences are first that you currently have to wear masks. If you've not worn one in a park like this all day, I recommend you try this out first. I recommend a highly breathable mask and it can't hurt to bring a motion sickness tablet if you get woozy, as it can take a little adjustment depending on the heat. Second, the tour guide used to be able to put your items in a backpack and now they have to be placed in lockers. Third, the buffet-style options of the past for food are now a sit-down service for each meal. However, you get more than your share of food, so I did not see this as an issue.  Finally, if you can get Paul for your tour I would highly recommend him! Paul had some great experiences and stories that made it another wonderful tour. He was so kind and an expert at gauging the group's mood and interest in terms of what we wanted to do during the day. I would be happy to do this tour again and especially with Paul.

title: Awesome Family Fun!
review_text: We visited the park June 14th - 17th and had an awesome experience. Sunday was busier than the rest of the days, but even then it wasn‚Äôt bad. Having to wear a mask the whole time is a bit annoying, but you‚Äôre able to sit down and take a break from wearing them when eating / drinking, or in the U-Rest designated areas. We rode every single ride in both Universal Studios Resort and Island of Adventure, and the longest line that we had to wait in was 30 minutes. I highly recommend purchasing the refillable cups for drinks throughout the day. It‚Äôs worth the cost. I also recommend eating in a restaurant where you make a reservation and actually sit down to eat, instead of the cafeteria style restaurants. You will spend almost the same amount of money and eat much better food. Also, some of the rides require you to store your items in a locker. Here is something to remember with the lockers: IF the locker requires you to scan your fingerprint in order to access it, then you will need to store everything in the locker, including your cellphone, wallet, fanny pack, etc. If the locker requires you to scan your park entry ticket (whether it is a physical ticket or a mobile ticket on your phone) then you can wear a fanny pack on the ride, and/or keep your phone with you. Don‚Äôt lock your phone up if the locker requires you to use your ticket to unlock it after the ride. Otherwise, you will have to get assistance from an employee and show your ID once you get your belongings out of the locker. I learned this the hard way. :)

title: Universal studios is horrible right now
review_text: Staff is very unfriendly right now. I thought the lines would be faster because not that many people at the park but some rides take an hour still. You have to wear face mask all day in the heat. They say stuff to anyone that has it to low. You have to order food through your phone you can't go through line anymore. Definitely a waste of a few hundred bucks today wait til life is normal!!!!

title: Every bit as good as Disney World
review_text: Okay, so Universal totally stole Mr. Disney's idea. The plan from Universal was this: build an amusement park in Orlando and get patronage from tourists who were already here for Disney World. (You can tell I'm pretty loyal to the Mouse.) But I must say, I enjoyed my time here even more than my day at the Magic Kingdom during my last visit. These are big words, but here's why: -Crowd management is key. Unlike the Magic Kingdom, I never found myself flabbergasted at the amount of time I spend in line. Considering I was here during a holiday weekend, the lines really weren't bad at all! -Harry Potter. They have tripped the area dedicated to JK Rowling's illustrious franchise, and it is completely epic. The Hogwarts Express, the (overpriced but delicious) frozen butterbeer, the fish and chips at Hog Head's tavern, the new state-of-the-art VR-type rides, and the lights show on Hogwarts castle at night make for a completely magical experience.  There is too much to do here in one day! It's a billion theme parks in one! If you're in Orlando, you'd be a fool to miss this. And--unlike Disney World--the lines are so short that there is no fast pass nessisary.

title: Family fun time
review_text: Fun family time for all ages. Even my 5 year old could ride all the rides except 2. I would suggest get express pass then you have to wait at most 20mins. We have yearly passes so we will go many times. They took care of us even with covid -19 issues.

title: Glad I visited during coronavirus!
review_text: Our first time at universal studios was excellent! I was pleasantly surprised on all levels - specifically the employees. I have seen many reviews describing rude employees, but for the most part I experienced quite the opposite. Some of the rides were so fantastic that I did them a LOT - The Incredible Hulk coaster 14 times in one day, and Revenge of the Mummy 13 times. This was my first time visiting Universal. We didn‚Äôt eat much from the parks but what we did get to enjoy didn‚Äôt disappoint. (You HAVE to try the butter beer fudge at Huneydukes!) I am so glad I went during coronavirus - we never waited over 30 minutes for a single ride our entire trip. Having to wear a mask was a little annoying but honestly, I didn‚Äôt notice it much. Not to mention Volcano Bay is the best water park in the world. P.S - the employees working at the Hulk deserve a raise, especially Bailey!

title: Universal during covid
review_text: Had a wonderful time at universal!! I felt safer there then in the grocery store from covid. Everything was spaced six feet apart. There are virtual lines and the employees were sanitizing nonstop. What a fun day got on every ride.

title: Family Trip
review_text: Universal is incredible. Clean park awesome rides fun for the whole family. Wish i lived in florida i would visit more often.

title: Vacation
review_text: First time Halloween horrors was great second time more leisurely just as great. Definitely will come back again.

title: Wait until after Covid blows over or better yet, if you are looking for actual rides, go to six flags.
review_text: I should qualify this review with the fact that we went on the first day back from the covid outbreak. June 5, 2020. I understand they have to reduce their liability but the social distance crap got old fast. I highly recommend you DO NOT GO TO THESE PARKS until life gets back to normal. That is unless you like wearing a mask or really like EVERY EMPLOYEE nagging you to wear it properly or if you like being made to use hand sanitizer on every ride. (I refused after doing it a few times. I wasnt touching anything and it was drying my hands out). Not to mention that if you take out the 248 restaurants and 367 souvenir shops, there are literally only 6-7 rides for people over 56‚Äù. We had fast passes and rode everything we could/wanted to in 2hrs. So we did it again. And again until it got monotonous. Ive been to a great number of parks and i swear i was shocked at how little there actually was to do. We will be hitting up somewhere else next time we need thrill rides.

title: New normal, be prepaid and you will enjoy
review_text: Being prepared and knowing what to expect is paramount to enjoying the new reality of a theme park visit. Temperature screening is quick. Face covering is required from the temp check forward. The only time face coverings may be removed is when eating (sitting at a table) or dirking. Pro tip- bring two or more face coverings per day, they will get wet, sweaty, and uncomfortable. I recommend two different types. The fishing neck and face guards are a great option to get a break from a mask. Most rides will require you to keep the covering on while riding. We did have one rogue employee tell us to put covering on while walking with a drink.  The major issue we found was a vast amount of misinformation and incorrect information. All queues have blue lines showing where to stand to ensure six feet or two meters from the party in front of you. This will cause queues to appear much longer than they are. All riders must use hand sanitizer prior to ridding each ride (great job Universal). There are also hand sanitizer dispensers after each ride and all over the park. They also spray and wiped rides between riders. Most rides will have rows between parties, this will cause long waits for key attractions. Attractions that require lockers have LONG waits for lockers. Restaurants are at 25 percent occupancy. This will cause long waits for tables. Use the app and pre-order to save hours.  There is no valet parking at the park or hotels.

title: Post COVID-19 "new normal"
review_text: I was one of first group who had a chance to sneak peak of new normal prior opening on June 5th to the public. First moment we walked in, I felt like coming back to the United States after September 11th. Tears were streaming down my eyes. Thanks Goodness for glasses and mask to hide my emotions. I personally think everyone who works in the park tries to do the best under the circumstances. I felt safe (germs wise) and didn't even need to use my sanitizer. I hope general public follows the instructions of the personnel: keep their distance, use sanitizer, and keep their masks on! We are all in this together!

title: A Book Nerd's Dream!
review_text: I solely went to Universal to enjoy The Wizarding World of Harry Potter and it was an awesome experience! Dressing in my Hufflepuff garb, getting my own wand that can be used throughout the park, interacting with the world itself, and drinking a nice cold frozen Butterbeer were among the highlights. Our group was entertained all day, even those less interested in the book series. I'd love to return one day!

title: Friends
review_text: My roommate is the biggest fan and in the summer we went there for like a week to explore and I must say, it's a very cool place. All of the kids are going crazy here.

title: First time, was a lot of fun, don't expect disney, but it's still a good experience
review_text: Don't go expecting Disney, it's not, but good in it's own way. Lots to see and I mean a lot. Seems almost disjointed, so, look up what all there is beforehand so that you know.  What was an A+: is Harry Potter (Wizarding World of) with the 3 broomsticks restaurant (food excellent) and all of the decor. The hogwarts ride in the big school - castle was an amazing ride mixed with roller coaster and 3d all in one! man is it fun. Butter beer carts everywhere, the train between parks (Hogwarts Express) were all amazing. Teens loved it and seemed very authentic. Knockturn alley is almost impossible to find, but cool in and of itself.  men in black ride is fun. Juraisic park portion is fun, especially meeting blue and boat ride - wait for the end of the ride, better than Disney's splash mtn. Dr Seuss land is pretty amazing. King Kong ride is worth the wait and another amazing 3d ride, where kong fights over the top of the bus.  Gru came by and it was fun. ET ride is good. Transformers is good. The candy factory by old jaws site.  Super hero area is pretty cool with heroes coming out and riding around, letting pictures being taken. If you like really fun roller coaster rides, go on the "Hulk!" It is fast, thrilling, upside down shoot you into the sky type ride.  Overall a good experience. Plan on spending money. Plan on a lot of time. On equal par with Disney for fun and memory making.

title: Amazing Park!
review_text: We visited with our 2 young kids prior to visiting the Disney parks. It is definitely geared towards older kids, teens and adults but there was still plenty for young kids as well. Everyone loved it and the food in the Wizarding World of Harry Potter was excellent!

title: June 5th baby!
review_text: Wow, it's already reopening! Can't wait to return! Were getting a 3 day pass soon! This place is amazing. So much better than Disney. Stuff for the whole family. Gonna take my mom and sister for the first time, I'm sure they will love it! The staff are amazing and the food is surprisingly cheap and delicious. Rides are SOOO fun! City walk is also really neat. And that's already open. Amazing times can't wait to return! Definitely the best theme park in america! Because when you wanna woah, there's only one place to go!

title: Dreamland Vacation
review_text: They have 3 parks; Universal Studios Florida, Universal‚Äôs Islands of Adventure and Volcano Bay. Volcano Bay is a water park, other 2 are theme parks. If you are a crazy Harry Potter fan, you MUST visit both the theme parks. We went during a week day and were able to finish both parks in 2 days without express pass. There's a Hogwart‚Äôs Express train that takes you from one park to another but for that you need ticket to both parks which allows you to visit both parks on same day. Butter beer in the Hogwart‚Äôs castle is a must. I would suggest finishing Harry Potter rides in Universal‚Äôs Islands of Adventure first as soon as you enter Universal, lines start growing between 11 & 2. You WILL get completely wet in Popeye‚Äôs ride, there is a dryer outside the ride for a $5. Volcano bay water park has multiple tube rides, they check your weight before you ride so that it is safe to ride. Aqua Coaster ride was the highlight. It is a roller coaster water ride which allows 2 to 4 riders per tube. They have a wave pool with beach like sand and chairs. There's a lazy river and a crazy river, you have to wear life jacket. It has a 80 degree slide from top of volcano mountain. You stand inside a tube and the floor beneath your legs opens. It scratches your back, I could see everyone‚Äôs back getting red rashes. There's a Bus stand for Universal between universal studios entrance and universal parking. Free shuttle buses run to universal hotels. There is also a free shuttle for Volcano Bay park.

title: Dreamland Vacation
review_text: Just mind blowing. They have 3 parks; Universal Studios Florida, Universal‚Äôs Islands of Adventure and Volcano Bay. Volcano Bay is a water park, other two are theme parks. If you are a crazy Harry Potter fan, you MUST visit both the theme parks. We went during a non holiday season in February during a week day. We were able to finish both the parks in two days without taking express pass. There is a Hogwart‚Äôs Express train that takes you from one park to another but for that you need ticket to both parks wherein you can visit both the parks on same day. Butter beer in the Hogwart‚Äôs castle is a must. I would suggest finishing Harry Potter rides in Universal‚Äôs Islands of Adventure first as soon as you enter Universal. Go as soon as park opens, lines start growing between 11 to 2. Shreik in Universal Studios Florida was a literal torture, we did not like it. You WILL get completely wet in Popeye‚Äôs ride, so make sure you carry additional clothes for the ride. There is a dryer outside the ride for a $5. Volcano bay water park was just fun. It has multiple tube rides, they check your weight every time before you ride so that it is safe to ride. Aqua Coaster ride was the highlight. It is a roller coaster water ride which allows minimum of 2 and maximum of 4 riders per tube. They have a wave pool with beach like sand and chairs. There is a lazy river that you can relax on a tube. There is also a crazy river with water flowing at a faster rate, you have to wear life jacket to go in. There is a 80 degree slide from the top of volcano mountain. You stand inside a tube and the floor beneath your legs opens and you slide down fast. Almost every one complained that it scratches your back, I could see everyone‚Äôs back getting red rashes. Overall universal studios was a total fun. I highly recommend if you are visiting Orlando.  There is a Bus stand for Universal. This place is between universal studios entrance and universal parking. Free shuttle buses run to universal hotels. There is also a to and fro free shuttle for Volcano Bay park.

title: Best Theme Park
review_text: I liked when I went to this theme park. It holds up to its name that when you ride the attractions in the park it does feel like you're part of the movies. The one store I liked going into was the Ciber Store that sold movie props from classic Universal Movies.

title: WOW WOW ....... Absolutely Incredible !!!!
review_text: Omg !!! Universal studios is absolutely amazing !!! Beat DIsney by far for my whole family . What an incredible day of fun , so exciting . The themes and the certain lands were so awesome so well done and creative . Simpsons land , not a big Simpsons person myself but man did they ever do this right . I loves it ! Every ride is unbelievable and sooo much fun . The whole atmosphere was out of this world that great . E.T. Well I‚Äôm a huge ET fan and couldn‚Äôt wait to come and buy some et stuff . And I think I bought it all ( stuffed ones, sweaters, tshirts, pen, towel, socks , lanyard .... omg made my day and the ride still one of the best I have been on . They did it justice for sure and you can‚Äôt just go on once believe you will ride it again and again it‚Äôs that great . The rock it roller coaster amazing ! Pick your own song and have a hell of ride ( limp bizkit does it justice Haha ). The mummy ride incredible , I mean everything is just that much fun and that incredible . And we waited 5mins-20 mins the longest how awesome is that . Can‚Äôt do that at Disney . Get the one meal pass definately worth it , you get fries burger and you can switch pop for a milkshake and pick a dessert ( like the big donut from the Simpsons and others definately worth the price . I really recommend it . We also bought the picture package which I probably didn‚Äôt get as much as I should of to make it worth it but oh well still worth it in the end got some family pics . And some places can take pic automatically without a person doing it . So I would recommend buying it . But definately don‚Äôt miss out it‚Äôs a must see and then a must see and do it all over again lol .

title: A highlight of an Orlando holiday!
review_text: I asked my partner for adjectives to quickly describe the experience we had at Universal Studios Florida: Exciting, Imaginative, Transporting, Epic, American! Which actually does pretty much sum up this park. I was very excited about visiting Universal Studios because there is nothing really comparable in Europe. Suffice to say it does not disappoint! The park and its attractions are world class, from the huge thrill rides, down to the smallest details you notice as you are walking around, you are totally immersed in movie land!  As a big Harry Potter fan (and a Londoner) I was delighted by how accurately London was represented outside Diagon Alley and the seamless transition into the magical world behind the passageways. I use Kings Cross Station regularly, so to see a scaled down replica of it standing at the back of the park was very surprising. Even more surprising were the real to life announcements of trains to Peterborough, calling at Stevenage and Huntingdon! They have a team working on the attractions who seem to want not just to add some fun rides and thrills, they want to go above and beyond to present unique and joyful experiences.  Being located around a large lagoon meant it was very easy to get our bearings and to make our way around the park without too much foot traffic. We were lucky when we visited in that we had fairly low crowds, so never waited much longer than 20 minutes to get on a ride (apart from Gringotts)!  The food offering is fairly standard theme park grub, but there are a couple of stand outs such as Florean Fortescue's Ice Cream parlour (I recommend the peanut butter and strawberry ice cream sundae), Voodoo Donuts (which is actually just outside the park on Citywalk), and the frozen butter beer from the Fountain of Fair Fortune.  We ended up spending a lot longer at Universal Studios than we anticipated because we also had tickets for Halloween Horror Nights which made the visit unforgettable!  I cannot wait to go back next year and jump on all the rides again!

title: Amazing time
review_text: For anyone 7 years + thus is a great park, majority of rides are simulated adventures, over family had an amazing time. We can easily say this park was our favourite even over Disney. Staying at a universal hotel gave us quick access to park with no additional parking fees.  We thoroughly enjoyed every ride and the new harry potters section is so cool (I‚Äôm not a Harry Potter fan).  Will definitely be back.

title: were coming back
review_text: were hoping to be coming back this year to this fabulous place we are bringing with us the whole family as we want them to experience this fantastic brilliant uplifting place we love it i urge every one visit at least once you will not regret it

title: Universal Studios FL
review_text: Universal Studios was fun, a lot to see and extremely crowded. We allowed ourselves a full 12 hour day for the one park and discovered that we could of used even more time to do everything that we would of like to do. Some people paid extra to jump the line and if you have children or teens I would recommend this even though it does cost more. As any park bring your wallet!

title: The Fear Factor contest was the best.
review_text: I just read the review of the person who was complaining about the Fear Factor eating contest. All I can say is that I did it too, and it was great. I don't know what was wrong with that person who wrote the review, but it sounds like somebody who's a whiny baby. The milk was not actually sour, and it was mostly fish, and insects are good for you, as there are countries everywhere who eat them as their source of protein. There was nothing in that mixture that would have hurt anybody. They say what they say to get the ick factor from the audience, and it's all part of the show. If you can't handle something like that, then you shouldn't bother to enter the contest. It's called Fear Factor for a reason. The park was great, and I enjoyed my day, but entering the Fear Factor contest was the highlight of my day. It's true that all you win is a cup with free refills, but just being part of it was worth it. Right after that contest, I went and got on a roller coaster. It didn't turn my stomach at all.

title: Best Rides
review_text: Love universal, best parks in Orlando. Great rides, something for everyone.  Can't wait to return next year.

title: I loved it!!!!
review_text: When we visited we were only supposed to go for 2 days but ended up going an extra 5 times during our 2 week stay. I have nothing bad to say about the parks. We went to universal, island of adventure and volcano bay. Because of coronavirus we have had to cancel our holiday for this year but are using the money to come back to universal next year. We are hoping to stay at one of their hotels because this also looked amazing. I would highly suggest buying the Coca Cola refill. You can have anything from water to fizzy drinks. Can‚Äôt wait to ride the Mummy again next year

title: Very good rides
review_text: Lots of amazing rides- especially simulator rides which was perfect for me as I don‚Äôt like rollercoasters. The theming is great and there is so much to see. Tickets are very pricey however you do get lots of rides for this. I did this and Islands of Adventure in one day so took the hogwarts express to here. The refill drink is worth the money. The shopping is great and we loved the shows. The park is so much quieter than Disney apart from the Harry Potter parts. These have such brilliant theming. Tip It takes over 10 mins to walk to where Lyft/Uber can pick you up so allow time for this. The espresso passes meant we did not queue for anything! You will have to sue free lockers for some rides to leave your bags but these are easy to use.

title: Amazing Mardi Gras Parade
review_text: What an amazing day we had here, a group of six, we all really enjoyed our day at Universal Studios. Having not visited the park in six years we were excited to see what was new. We enjoyed the Fast & the Furious ride as it put us right in the center of the action. This park has fantastic roller coasters, characters, shows and street performances. The Diagon Alley area in the Harry Potter park is fantastic, where every little detail is spot on. There are also a lot of simulator type rides which are fabulous. There are lot of different food options spread throughout the park, so plenty of choice. Our favorite part of this visit was the Mardi Gras Parade, the costumes and the floats were breathtaking. There were so many beads being thrown into the crowd, we came home with heaps. A fantastic experience!

title: Very disappointed with lack of response!
review_text: We visited Universal in January. We purchased the hopper pass solely for the Harry Potter Hogwart Exress between the parks. In addition the one experience we wanted to see was Jurassic Park. First of all, Jurassic Park was closed for updating. We accepted this, but it wasn‚Äôt noted prior to purchasing our tickets. Next, the Hogwart Express was closed for planned maintenance, which is solely the only reason we purchased a hopper pass. There were other issues as well. The absolute inexcusable issue is that these items were sent to Universal in a letter in January. As of yet, we have not received a response to our concerns. Consumers deserve the respect of a response.

title: Superb
review_text: What a place!! There is so much to see and do! There is plenty to do and see for all ages. Staff are so friendly and very helpful. The Harry Potter section is well worth a visit only problem is you can not enter Hogwarts school. You can not walk around it as it is a ride. The prices have increased while we were there so bare that in mind and it is $25 for parking.

title: Amazing!
review_text: An amazing holiday that is fun for everyone. There is so much to do there, from roller coasters to live performances on stage. Definitely going back!

title: Florida is lucky to have this place!
review_text: I went with my 33-year old daughter and her dad, and we had way more fun than we expected. There is so much to see and do; we were there for three days and it wasn't enough time. My favorite part of the park was the Harry Potter section. Even though I'm not a Potter superfan I still truly enjoyed that place. My only complaint and the reason I gave Universal Studios four stars is they need a shuttle service. Even though our hotel dropped us off at the entrance of the park, you then have a VERY, VERY,LONG walk to get to the main park entrance. After a long day that walk seemed even longer!

title: Impossible to see it all and make sure you can walk long distances!
review_text: I‚Äôve never seen a theme park like this one! You could spend every day here for a week and still not see it all! Wizarding World of HP was hands down my favorite. I enjoyed the Jurassic Park section also. I would love to see them offer cheaper tickets for smaller areas (passes strictly to Wizarding World, etc). Also, we stayed at a Universal hotel and despite taking the shuttle it was a LONG walk from the drop off location to Wizarding World! They need some kind of in park transportation?!

title: Great Time to Visit Universal Orlando!
review_text: We were in Florida for the last two weeks of February. We enjoyed a three day park to park passport at Universal Studios. This gave us a day at each of the attractions. We also purchased the Fast Pass, as I have a disability that made waiting in lines painful. This was well worth the cost, as we spent little time in lines. The park was clean, bright, a little loud for my taste, but it didn't bother my son or husband. We enjoyed everything we could squeeze in each day. The rides/attractions are very interesting and fun, though my son was too large for all of the Harry Potter rides on both sides of the train ride, and that was the main reason that he went to Universal.He has Autism, and this was very distressing for him. We found lots of various souvenirs to purchase, including our family crests and histories! My son worked on his key chain collection, and managed to get several items from the Harry Potter collection for his "House". We had a fabulous time, tried all different kinds of food, went on wonderful rides and attractions, saw amazing things, and can't wait to come back?

title: Truly entertaining
review_text: Where to begin! This place was incredible....The rides, the ambience, was all incredible. Less expensive than Disney, but really geared toward teens and above, a truly memorable vacation. Even being there when it was too hot and humid at that time, we still had a blast. Tips for travelers; the Universal Pass or staying in a hotel on property that offers the Universal Pass will really save you from standing in line too long.

title: Hagrid's Magical Creatures Motorbike Adventure ride
review_text: We returned to Universal Studios Florida for a third time to experience Hagrid's Magical Creatures Motorbike Adventure ride, and it didn't disappoint! We've remained nothing but impressed at the detail of the attractions, there. We're consummately smitten with the Harry Potter attractions, but it doesn't stop there. This trip, we also braved Hurricane Dorian as it hit landfall. Fortunately, we were able to fly out before it got too bad. Extra tip: Try to get to the Leaky Cauldron‚Ñ¢ in Diagon Alley‚Ñ¢ for their breakfast. It is delicious and plentiful. Whether you want to gorge like Harry and Ron on their fresh scrambled eggs, sausage links, black pudding, English bacon, baked beans, grilled tomato, saut√©ed mushrooms and breakfast potatoes. Or, stay a 'Merican and dig out on some fresh scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, crisp bacon, and link sausage with butter croissant. The freshly baked flan of apples and oatmeal served with yogurt and fresh seasonal fruit was also a delight.

title: nice place
review_text: lovely place to walk round, queues a bit long for what we are used to, timing is everything here. kids enjoyed it.

title: What a great way to spend a day or two
review_text: Loved it here, even though I am in my late 50s. Didn't do all the ride but the ones I did were great.

title: Very fun even if you don't ride the rides
review_text: My husband and I enjoyed our visit to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. It is fun to walk around the areas. The food isn't too expensive and the fast food ordering is well organized. The main draw for me was the two Harry Potter areas: Diagon Alley and Hogsmeade. I really got into the mood of the movies. The shops are fun to browse, and the shows were entertaining, especially the Beedle the Bard show, which I watches twice. Many of the shows have ASL interpreters. If you are a Simpsons fan, the Simpsons area was very fun, with Lard Lad, Quik-E-Marts, etc. The Simpsons ride was amazing. I almost wish the lines for the attractions were slower because the entertainment in the lines was very amusing. Even though I am too large for the Gringott's ride, the staff was kind enough to recommend that I walk through the line to see Gringott's bank lobby (fabulous) and some little shows along the way. Be sure to stop at the Knight Bus to chat with the shrunken head. The Jurassic Park area was very clever. It is next to Hogsmeade, so we went from one John Williams theme to another. There were lots of benches to sit on, some in the shade. Lots of walking just to get from the parking garage to the entrance of the park. To save money on drinks, bring a water bottle. There are drinking fountains near the restrooms.

title: Wonderful experience
review_text: I had a very great experience with my family. Even though we had to walk a lot we really enjoyed it and I recommend for you to go on a family vacation with the people you love here.

title: Fun day
